item.title: “Art Macao” | Galeria Hwa presents work by Zhang Zhanzhan
item.description:
The “Art Macao - International Art Biennial of Macau 2025” arrived in the city and with it various cultural initiatives. One is the new exhibition in the HWA gallery at Lisbon Macau, which reveals the work of artist Zhang Zhanzhan. "Hi, luck!" It is evident until September
It is around the theme of luck that rotates the new exhibition of the HWA gallery, patent at Lisbon Macau. “Hi, Luck!”, With works by Zhang Zhanzhan, this year's edition of “Art Macao: International Art Biennial of Macau 2025” and is available for public visits until September. According to an official note about the event, this exhibition is held in partnership with Artdeport and presents the work of the well-known Chinese contemporary artist. This is one of the "collateral exhibitions" of the Biennial, which has as its theme "Hey, what brings it here?", Exploring the ideas of "seeing, enjoying and embracing the luck of art that transforms the chaos of life in a significant way." According to the same note, the artist “is known for his philosophical depth and innovative vision”, and the collections and exhibitions he has made throughout Asia “are observations of daily life with existential contemplation, showing Zhang's characteristic fusion between visual brilliance and intellectual resonance to present luck as a significant human experience”. There According to the official page of “Art Macao”, Zhang Zhanzhan believes that “luck is not a fortuitous gift, but a disposition of mind marked by a keen conscience, an active search and a sincere welcome in daily life.” Thus, the works present in the HWA Gallery “captures fragments of time, guiding him to 'see luck'-the subtle brightness in the morning fog”, or to “grasp luck”, exploring the idea of a “flying in fleeting meetings”, or to “embrace luck”, in which the public can, by visualizing the artistic work, “intertwining the warmth of life with the world”. Thus, in this exhibition, "art serves as a flashlight, illuminating the meaning in chaos and together exploring the true essence of luck." Zhang Zhanzhan was born in Hebei in 1982, having graduated from the Nanjing University School of Arts of Arts in 2008. One of the latest exhibitions he held was in 2023, named “Out of This World”, patent at the Yinchuan Museum of Contemporary Art. The previous year, the artist debuted "Post Me Generation: How to Write About Young Artists" in Beijing. Last year, and also in Beijing, Zhang Zhanzhan held “You’re Always on My Mind” at Beijing's well -known Art District.

item.title: CCAC | Bribes have decreased significantly
item.description:
The commissioner against corruption has indicated that “in recent years”, situations of abuse of power and bribes have decreased significantly. The agency led by Ieong Seong points out that current cases are more violations of general duties, such as falsification of attendance records
"With the efforts made over the years, the number of typical cases of corruption in public services involving situations of abuse of power to receive bribes has decreased significantly in recent years," said the director of Administration and Public Function Services (SAFP), Leong Weng In, citing the Commissioner against Corruption (CCAC). The reduction of cases involving abuse of power and bribes is attributed to the harsh combat to the phenomenon, as well as the awareness actions carried out by CCAC to change mindsets in the civil service, is indicated in a response to the interpellation of Deputy Nick Law by the SAFP director. Leong Weng In cites CCAC in an analysis of the most frequent types of offenses these days. "Currently, cases related to public services workers are mainly related to the violation of the general duties to which they are subject, such as cases of falsification of attendance records and illegal accumulation of functions, which demonstrates that their work has achieved positive results," is indicated. Good behavior To keep up with the evolution of the type of infractions more frequently committed, CCAC has adjusted the content of awareness actions “depending on the trend”. “CCAC has continually drawing their attention also, in the context of training, to the importance of ethical conduct,” is indicated by Leong Weng In. The SAFP Director even points out that after infringements are detected, "many public services invite, by its initiative CCAC." The fight against corruption is a continuous and long -term process that has to be viewed with a pragmatic and realistic attitude so that it can be effective to respond to my trends of infringements, it is still mentioned.

item.title: Sport | 26 million supports for athletes and associations
item.description:
Between April and June this year, the Sport Fund assigned support of 26.1 million patacas. The most supported entity was the Macao Football Association, receiving 3.18 million Patacas
The Sport Fund distributed 26.1 million patacas on support to athletes and associations in the second quarter of the year. The data were updated on the Portal of the Directorate of Supervision and Management of Public Assets (DSSGAP). The most supported entity in the second quarter was the Macao Football Association by receiving 3.18 million patacas, which represented 12.2 percent of the total distributed supports. The soccer association also received one of the largest unit support, in this case in the amount of almost 526,000 Patacas, for the organization of football championships 7 in the U14 and U-12 categories. The second most supported entity was the Macau-China General Association of Automobile by receiving a total of 2.77 million patacas, between six subsidies to support pilots or rent facilities. Only in facilities rental costs alone, the association received 1.4 million patacas, although about 514,000 patacas still respects a rental for December last year. Also in this case, when evaluated the proportion of the supports, AAMC received more than 10 percent of the supports distributed to 55 associations. In terms of unit subsidies, the largest amount delivered to the Macau-China General Automobile Association and reached 576,000 patacas. This amount was distributed in April and again in May and was justified with the support of the participation of six local riders in proofs abroad. Gold wushu However, the highest unit support reached the amount of 1.32 million patacas and was distributed to the General Association of Wushu de Macao, with the official explanation of the second installment of the “Financial Support Plan for the Training of Elite Athletes and Teams in Internship 2025 - subsidies for elite athletes and the Wushu Internship team”. Between April and June, the Wushu Association was one of the most supported by the Sport Fund, in second place, receiving about 2.67 million Patacas, among 12 different subsidies, which represented 10.2 percent of total financial support. The second largest unit support was 813,000 patacas and was recipient by the Macau-China Dragon Boat Association. The official justification indicates that the subsidy filed the second installment of the “Financial Support Plan for the Training of Elite Athletes and Teams in Internship 2025 - Dragon Boat Elite Athletes”. In total, the Dragon Boat Association received four different subsidies that totaled 975,000 patacas, with the remaining supports to fit the organization of local evidence or participation in events abroad. The data also show that the support of the sport fund grew 3.5 million patacas compared to the same period.

item.title: Maternity | “Independent Entity” studies license increase
item.description:
The government has been responsible for a “third independent entity” of elaborating a study on increasing maternity leave and annual holidays. In five months, Dsal made almost 900 inspections of combating illegal work, which resulted in the punishment of only three employer entities
The Secretary for Economics and Finance, Tai Kin IP, had already indicated that the government was working to adjust the number of maternity leave and annual holidays in a plenary session of the Legislative Assembly. The acceleration of the process was confirmed by the Director of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL), Chan Un Tong, who revealed that the government has commissioned a third independent entity to proceed with an inquiry and study on the increase in labor standards, namely the issue of maternity leave, currently fixed in 70 days, and vacation. The Macao Law establishes the annual vacation number paid in six days, a rule that has not changed for four decades and many companies have ignored more generous contracts for workers. Public officials enjoy 22 days of paid vacation. However, the director of Dsal stresses the need to “reach consensus between the parts of employers and workers”, through the Permanent Council for Social Concertation (CPCs). To this end, “considering that the revision of labor legislation involves several social factors”, the executive emphasizes that it is necessary to “consider the general interests of Macao” and make a public consultation. The point of situation on the reform of labor laws was advanced by the director of Dsal in response to a written interpellation of Leong Hong Sai. A lot One of the unavoidable themes when it comes to market and labor laws in Macau is the issue of non-resident workers (TNR). The residents' deputy did not let the opportunity to request the improvement of the inspection to irregularities involving TNR. In this respect, Chan Un Tong indicated that between January and May this year, DSAL made a total of 874 inspections, which resulted in the application of administrative sanctions to 856 people due to illegal work "(including" exercise of duties in place/ for employer different from authorized "," exercise of alien functions to authorized ", illegal worker and work on their own)". However, despite the nearly 900 inspections made, only three employing entities were “punished with ancillary sanctions”, such as the revocation of contracting authorizations regarding 10 non-resident workers. The three employers were also prevented for six months from requesting new TNR hiring authorizations. The issue of “voluntary overtime” and the right to rest was also mentioned. The director of DSAL recalled that the law defines that the normal working period cannot exceed 48 hours per week, with this number of hours only the maximum weekly limit of the normal working period. However, the law opens the hypothesis of agreement between employer and worker for length of service, "the employer should assure the worker 10 consecutive hours of rest per day, in a total of not less than 12 hours."

item.title: Elections | Caeal says Alberto Wong's statements are defamatory
item.description:
Judge Seng Ioi Man denies that the Electoral Commission has made any pressure for the Popular Liveliod Strength list in Macau to give up direct suffrage, even before being excluded
The Commission of Electoral Affairs of the Legislative Assembly (Caeal) denied the statements in which he was accused of pressuring the list led by Alberto Wong to give up the elections. The position was taken yesterday by the president of Caeal, Judge Seng Ioi Man, during a press conference. "I also noticed in this comment and this comment is not true. And about these comments that are not true, in fact they are harming and defamed Caeal, so we can ask them [authors] who take responsibility for defamation," said Seng Ioi Man. Walking At yesterday's press conference, Seng Ioi Man also took stock of the work for the September 14 elections. According to the president of Caeal, for election day will be chosen “more than 1,300 workers” for the distribution of bulletins and counting the votes. This number does not take into account employees who will be in the voting places to maintain public order and safety. As a precautionary plan, Caeal asked public services to form training on the election night to 2,200 workers, of which 1,300 will then be chosen. "We contacted 2,200 people, and then select the fittest workers who are responsible for counting votes and distribution of votes bulletins," he said. "We have already done an action of training in the first phase and after completing an online evaluation people will be indicated to assume their position," he added. In addition, CAEAL has also met with representatives of six lists, to inform them of the materials that can be distributed during the election campaign and where it molds. The election campaign is allowed by the authorities between August 30 and September 12. Caeal | PLACED DESIGN OF VOTE CABINES The Electoral Commission of the Legislative Assembly released yesterday the design of the voting booths of the upcoming elections for the choice of deputies of Hemiciclo. According to an official note, the spaces where voters will deposit the voting newsletters "will be covered by semi -transparent curtains, ensuring the confidentiality of the vote and allowing the voting table employees to properly monitor if irregularities occur." In addition, each voting cabin “will have a table with specific stamps to fill the voting newsletters, as well as informative posters that show voters how they can correctly fill the bulletins and explain that the document is forbidden. More than 770 voting booths are available for direct and indirect elections, an increase of 80 spaces compared to four years elections. In this way, he said Caeal, "more voters are allowed to vote at the same time, accelerating the vote and reducing waiting time." There are spaces adapted to people with disabilities.

item.title: Dengue Fever | Authorities warn of the risk of imported cases
item.description:
Macau is facing a “high risk” period of imported cases of dengue fever and chikungunya. The warning was reiterated yesterday at a joint conference on health services and the institute for municipal affairs. Last year's dengue fever cases have been the highest of the last two decades
Health services (SS) and the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMIs) joined yesterday to alert the population to the growing risk of imported cases of dengue fever and chikungunya fever, given that the summer period is synonymous with more travel and travel. At a press conference, Leong Iek Hou, doctor and head of the SS disease prevention and control center, said that "there was an increase in cases of dengue fever and chikungunya fever in neighboring regions, which is a high risk to Macao." In addition, he added, "we know that we are in the summer time, there is an increase in the number of Macao residents who travel abroad, or tourists traveling to Macao, factors that may increase the risk of disease." Thus, “the risk of cases [fever] in Macau is high,” said the official. Leong Iek Hams advanced some numbers, having said that until Sunday, 2,285 confirmed fever cases were reported, 2,100 occurred only in Shunde district. In the case of Macao, between 2013 and 2019 there were “two to three imported cases of chikungunya fever, all from Southeast Asia”, but in recent years it has increased, although there are no serious cases. Leong Iek Hou also highlighted the fact that, last Friday, Macau registered the first imported case of this year's Chikungunya fever. According to a statement issued by the SS that same day, the patient is a 61 -year -old man, resident and resident in the Cheng I building, on Avenida do Conselheiro Borja. Between July 8 and 17, the patient moved to Shunde district in Foshan, with the aim of visiting family members. However, they describe the SS, on the morning of the 17th “began to present symptoms such as fever, headaches, muscle and joint aches, among others”, having returned Macao and sought medical treatment at the Conde de São Januário hospital center. On the 18th, the public health laboratory confirmed the presence of the Chikungunya virus, with a positive result. To date, the patient has kept stable. Since the beginning of the year and until July 19, the city of Foshan recorded a total of 1,873 confirmed cases of chikungunya fever, of which 1,790 are from Shunde district, focusing mainly on the villages of Lecong, Beijiao, Chenncun. 49 cases occurred in the district of Chancheng, focusing mainly on the sub-district of Shiwanzhen, Zumiao and Zhangcha; While 34 cases were detected in the Nanhai district, focusing mainly on the Guicheng sub-district. A dengue of the worst As for dengue fever cases, Leong Iek Hama pointed out that by 2024 the occurrence of this disease "it was relatively more severe when compared to the last 20 years, as 38 cases of dengue were recorded, nine locations." "This year were registered eight cases imported of dengue fever, being a place," said the SS official. It was also said that it is possible to lock and combat these infections through, for example, the cleaning of stagnant water, which attracts the proliferation of mosquitoes. “This year we have done more work to eliminate mosquitoes with Jardim Camões,” said Fong Vai Seng, head of the AMI Environmental Hygiene Department. "We can say that we can eliminate mosquitoes that can be carriers of the virus [causer of fevers], avoiding its transmission. In any of the forms we are at the peak of cases, and residents and tourists may be carried to the virus, so we have to be alert. We have done a series of cleaning work to avoid the source of mosquitoes proliferation, and until June [since the year] we have supervised about 7,400 spaces." It was mentioned. Inspection actions took place in 140 places that are considered “black points” with regard to the proliferation of mosquitoes, and between January and June this year, 1,220 chemical elimination actions of these insects were made. Both entities promise to work side by side in cleaning land. “AMI and SS have a mechanism for monitoring and treatment of hygiene problems in private spaces or unoccupied land. Whenever the ss find that there is danger to public health, or in case of an emergency situation, and whenever it is not possible to contact the landowners, AMI will collaborate in removing containers or zones with stagnant waters that may serve as proliferation of Mosquitoes, ”was said at the press conference. Leong Iek Hou also explained that there are not yet many places in Macao where tests can be done that disapprove of the infection. "There are not many medical institutions that have this type of test available. When clinics or private hospitals want to take the test for the displaying of transmitted diseases, these institutions send us blood samples and we do the tests in our public health laboratory for free for various types of fever, given that symptoms are similar." Hong Kong on Alert The risk alert of more imported cases of these two types of fever has also arrived in Hong Kong. According to the South China Morning Post newspaper on Thursday, several experts warn of the high risk of infections taking into account the outbreak registered in the city of Foshan, belonging to Guangdong province. Wong Hoi-Kei, a senior doctor and head of the Guangdong Center for Health Protection, said that "although outbreaks do not occur in popular cities among Hong Kong inhabitants, frequent trips between Guangdong and Hong Kong mean the risk of imported cases is higher." Also quoted by the same newspaper, doctor Joseph Tsang Kay-Yan, an infectious illness expert, said it is possible that Hong Kong will have imported cases that could lead to sporadic infections, and explained that the two types of fevers have similar symptoms, but with a big difference: with chikungunya fever, patients feel joint pain. Wong Hoi-Kei said that several cleaning actions are being developed to avoid proliferation of mosquitoes and to inform the population for symptoms. "We have the ability to reduce the risk of an outbreak triggered by imported cases as much as possible," Wong said. This year alone, and according to data released by SCMP, more than 220,000 cases of chikungunya fever were recorded worldwide in 14 locations, including the Taiwan and Singapore regions. The latest cases of this type of fever in Hong Kong had occurred in 2019, with only 11 patients. According to the SS, the means of transmission and measures to prevent and control chikungunya fever and dengue fever are identical, both transmitted by bite of mosquitoes of the "Aedes albopictus" species, which usually reproduce in small amounts of stagnant, clean and stopped water. Given the recent passage through Macao do Typhoon Wipha, the authorities yesterday remembered the importance of cleaning these spaces. Chikungunya fever is a viral disease and has a period of incubation of three to eight days, which can vary between two and 12 days, with fever symptoms and then joint pain in body areas such as wrists, knees, ankles and fingertips. Two to three days later rashes appear. "The whole course of the disease usually lasts five to seven days, being the state of health of most patients considered light," explains the SS.

item.title: FRC | Timor-Leste images exhibited until August
item.description:
It is called “a trip to the land of crocodile in the year of the serpent” and is the new exhibition of photography in the Rui Cunha Foundation, by Cristiana Figueiredo. The images are added to Bibi Ain's texts. There are 25 photographs of “people, places and things”, on a trip full of emotions
The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) inaugurates today, from 6.30 pm, a photographic exhibition about Timor-Leste entitled “A Trip to the Land of Crocodile in the year of the serpent”, with images by Cristiana Figueiredo and texts by Bibi Ain. This initiative "results from a trip of discovery, for one, and from reunion to the other at the beginning of this year." With the subtitle “People. Places. Things”, the show includes 25 photographs that visually reveal what texts describe about the emotions impregnated in the small details of the journey. According to the authors, cited by a FRC note, "at the beginning of 2025 we embarked on a trip to Timor-Leste," was "the discovery of home roots, the hug of the loved ones, the reappearance of sweet and fragile memories," or "enter a history book and feel the welcome of the unknown." "The trip was an intimate and inspiring lighthouse in Timor-Leste, where seemingly disparate perspectives came together to create new perspectives, about the people and places of this wonderful small country," reveals the pair of travelers in his manifesto. Cristiana Figueiredo further states that "behind the lens, I witnessed the transformation of timid behaviors into generous tropical smiles that revealed intimate glimpses and fleeting ”. item.title: MNE | China expresses the desire to reinforce partnership with EU before Cimeira
item.description: China yesterday expressed the intention of reinforcing the partnership with the European Union (EU), before the bilateral summit that takes place this week in Beijing, in a context marked by commercial tensions and geopolitical disputes. "The country hopes that the meeting with European leaders will send a positive signal to the international community that both parties are committed to strengthening their partnership and jointly defending multilateralism and open cooperation," said Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun. The diplomat indicated that relations between China and EU cross “a crucial moment”, with “new opportunities and challenges”, and that the summit will serve to “reinforce strategic communication” and “deepen dialogue and cooperation” at a time of growing global instability. According to Guo, the bilateral relationship has produced “fruit results” over the last 50 years, both in the economic plan and in the creation of international cooperation mechanisms. Summit China-EU is held on Thursday in Beijing to mark the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two parts. The participation of Chinese President XI Jinping, the President of the European Commission, Ursula Von Der Leyen, and the President of the European Council, António Costa. The latter said on Monday that the relationship between China and the EU has a "crucial" role globally and expressed its intention to discuss with the Chinese authorities all points on the common agenda. Brussels has already indicated that it will address topics such as access to the Chinese market, war in Ukraine, climate change and the situation in the Middle East.

Beside a brief poem: «I paint a scene sublime and eloquent, yielding to the fantasy of capturing the sounds of the mountains. I will try to deliver it to this man from the sound mountains, that will arrive at this time to meet And then it will return. » It can be imagined that this mountain inhabitant, who once a year goes down for a date, be someone like his close friend Wan Shouqi (1603-1652) who, two years after the fall of the Ming, becomes a monk and withdrawn only to the brush arts. And that sometimes illustrated from Doistists on the border of credibility, such as Fei Changfang, possessing a baton that allowed him to travel unbelievable distances. Zhu Ling not only followed in his paintings the characteristic style of Huang Gongwang (1269-1354), the master author of the Fuchun mountain roll, with the accumulation of small separate traces cun, 'wrinkles', to describe the shapes of the mountains, such as his alternative name (zi) derives from his phrase. Adopted by a rich family, in a child, he would have exclaimed at the time: Huang Gongwang Zi Jiu, "Mr. Huang had long wanted to have a child," whose first part Huang Gongwang would be adopted as his name, and the last Zijiu as his alternative name. item.title: War | Historians defend a monument about Vitória against Japanese invasion
item.description:
In a year of celebration of the 80th anniversary of China's victory in the war against Japanese aggression, Macao schools were encouraged by the government to convey these historical episodes to students. In the fervor of the ephemeris, an academic defended the construction of a monument to mark the date. HM has heard historians who enhance the ideas that should be transmitted by the monument
2025 is the year in which the 80th anniversary of China's victory is celebrated in the so -called Chinese people's resistance war against Japanese aggression and anti -fascist World War, that is, when China and Hong Kong managed to escape the Japanese occupation. Macao, having Portuguese administration, and for having kept neutral during World War II, was not occupied by the Japanese, although the neutrality status was quite volatile, as historian Helena Lopes showed in the work “Neutrality and Collaboration in South China: Macau During the Second World War”. In this context, the authorities have encouraged the territory schools to remember the historical episode through various activities with a patriotic nature, while Lin Guangzhi, director of the Institute for Social and Cultural Research of the University of Science and Technology of Macao (Must in the English), argued that a monument of war in Japan with Japan should be created in Macau. HM invited two historians, experts in this historical period, to comment on what has indeed happened in these years and what main messages should be transmitted if the construction of the monument actually advances. Alfredo Gomes Dias, professor of the Lisbon Polytechnic Institute and author of the Doctoral Thesis on Macaense Diaspora in World War II and the Foundation of the Popular Republic of China, entitled “The Macaense Diaspora. Macau, Hong Kong, Shanghai (1850-1952)”, argues that the celebration of this historical period is common to several countries. "In the case of China, the end of the Japanese invasion, taking into account the violence of which it has covered, can and should be celebrated generically throughout the Chinese territory," he said. But considering that Hong Kong had an effective occupation, while Macau dealt with refugee seizures and power games between Portuguese, Chinese, English, and Japanese, will make sense to have a monument on the mashes? Alfredo Gomes Dias understands yes. “In the case of Macao, the monument is emphasized if he perpetuates the memory that Chinese, Portuguese and Macanese have fought the invasion, especially on the island of Hong Kong, many of them died on the battlefield. In addition, Macau maintained the tradition of being a territory of refuge that housed Chinese and Macanese from Hong Kong.” Essentially, the researcher understands that "in any of the cities he can be erected," but in the particular case of Macao, it is important that the monument "intends to take into account the specificity of the history of Macao and the diversity of origin of its residents." Moreover, which argues that it should "preserve the memory of all who have joined side by side to oppose Japanese imperialism at this time." “Ambiguous neutrality” For Helena Lopes, a particular interest historian in Macao's landscape in World War II, and author of the work on Macao's neutrality during this period, said she did not see "no problem in building a commemorative monument of World War II in Macao." In the 1930s and 40s of the twentieth century, he recalls, "most of the population was, like today, Chinese," although "a significant number of the population was refugee, having sought in Macao (such as in other places not occupied in China) shelter of conflict violence." Thus, Helena Lopes, professor of history at contemporary Asia at the University of Cardiff, in Wales, says it is "normal for China to celebrate victory in World War II, as other allied countries do." Regarding Macao's neutrality, the historian says it was "ambiguous", given that "many opposite sides crossed the territory during the war." In these years, "the territory has been deeply linked to networks of resistance and humanitarian aid during the war: it was not isolated from conflict, but it was deeply linked to several of its dynamics identically to other territories in China under foreign rule (such as foreign concessions of Shanghai or Hong Kong until these territories were completely occupied)." In this context, he adds Helena Lopes, "it seems natural to celebrate resistance against Japan during the war, where they participated - openly or underground - several people in Macao (Chinese and other nationalities)," he said. THE ROLE OF HISTORICAL EDUCATION Territory schools have been "encouraged" by the Directorate of Youth Education and Development Services (DSEDJ) to organize sessions for students and teachers to watch the ceremonies of the "80th anniversary of the Chinese people's victory in the war against Japan and world victory against fascism." According to a press conference organized to announce these initiatives, the celebrations of the 80th anniversary of victory against the Japanese start on September 3 in Beijing, and DSEDJ intends to organize various events in Macao. Asked about the inclusion of historical celebrations, with a patriotic nature, in local schools, Helena Lopes says “having no elements to comment on the educational situation in Macao currently”, recalling that in the years of World War II, “schools in Macau were themselves, refuge spaces and resistance to Japanese occupation of China”. In turn, Alfredo Gomes Dias stresses that “historical education is always an extension of the narrative of national history”, “a reality common to all countries” and not exclusive to Macau. The DSEDJ press conference for the presentation of commemorative events was attended by the secretary for social and culture affairs, LAM, which has the Pelouro da Education. The ruler said last June that the government's goal is to "promote the great spirit of the War of Resistance" and "inspire patriotic fervor." All activities will be subordinate to the theme: "Remember the story, stroking the memory of the martyrs, caressing peace and creating the future." One of the highlights of the celebrations will be the memory of the victims of the Nanjing massacre, a celebration scheduled for December 13. The Nanjing massacre took place in 1937, having stepped for a few weeks after the conquest by the Japanese troops of the one who was the capital of the Republic of China. After the conquest, the Japanese troops massacred the population, including children, women and not combatants. The invasion of China through Japan began in 1931 with the occupation of Manchuria at first. In 1937, Japan expanded the scope of war, seeking the total occupation of China. What began as a conflict located in Asia would eventually be integrated in World War II, from December 1941, with the attacks of Pearl Harbor. Over the course of several years, estimates point out that on the Chinese side between 3.8 million and 10.6 million people died. Peace was reached on December 2, after the United States attacked Japan with the second atomic bomb in Nagasaki. HM sent questions to Lin Guangzhi, author of the idea of building a monument, but until the closing of this edition was not obtained.

item.title: Sao Tome and Prince | Relationship with China is discreet, but strategic
item.description:
On Saturday, 50 years of the independence of Sao Tome and Principe were celebrated. The future advances to the rhythm of diplomatic relations with other Portuguese speaking countries. For academic Cátia Miriam Costa, the African country and China are strategic partners, despite the description of the relationship between both
Researcher Cátia Miriam Costa considers that the relationship between Sao Tome and Principe and China remains discreet, despite being almost celebrating a decade, with a growing strategic interest of Beijing in the position of the archipelago in the South Atlantic. "Since neither country nor another talks much about the subject, we ended up not realizing the depth of the relationship well. But I believe it is not yet a very deep relationship," the researcher at the Center for International Studies of ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, noted to the Lusa. The geostrategic position of the archipelago, located in the Gulf of Guinea,, however, feeds Beijing's interest, namely in the context of the Chinese bet on the expansion of logistics and sea corridors in the South Atlantic. "Sao Tome, if it is not a very important port in logistical terms, is a relevant port for control, for example, of piracy, threats. Therefore, this position also certainly reflected by Beijing," he explained. The restoration of formal ties in 2016, after two decades of Taiwan's recognition by Sao Tome, was a “pragmatic” decision of the African country, and a trump card for Beijing Diplomacy, which always maintained “open channels”, even during the period of removal, Cátia Miriam Costa explained. "The relationship with China is more fruitful because it brings other counterparts," explained the researcher. "It was also for these counterparts that [in 1997] Sao Tome exchanged the Popular Republic of China for Taiwan, because at that time the Popular Republic of China was a developing country. So it didn't have to offer what Taiwan had, which was perfectly integrated into the international market," he said. A VOLTE-FACE In December 2016, Sao Tome officially announced the establishment of relations with the Popular Republic of China, ending the recognition of Taiwan. The decision caused the immediate cancellation of the scholarships offered by Taiwan to St.-Tome students, many of whom were eventually integrated into the other Chinese universities. China has quickly become one of the main cooperation partners in São Tomé, with promises of investment and support in areas such as education, technical training, agriculture and infrastructure. The researcher recalled that even before formal relations, Beijing never completely broke with Sao Tome, keeping the country involved in the activities of the Macao Forum, albeit only as an observer, a strategy he considers "typical of Chinese diplomacy." "China does not fully close the doors. It can suspend relationships, but if it is something of national interest, it is usually renegotiated again," he said. “Limited Results” Nevertheless, Cátia Miriam Costa acknowledged that the concrete results of cooperation are still limited. “There are more projects in the role than properly ongoing works,” he said, attributing part of the responsibility to the weak institutional capacity of São Tomé, which only recently began to create structures to attract and negotiate foreign investment. Among the sectors with the potential for the deepening of cooperation, the researcher highlighted the fishing, the marine resources and eventually the cocoa. Oil exploration raises “high risks”, both for technical complexity and environmental limitations. "China is interested in the region, but it is not because Sao Tome is an attractive market -because it is not -, yes, for its location, stability and integration capacity in a broader regional project," he said. The researcher also stressed Chinese investment in Chinese language teaching in Sao Tome, which also aims to "create a network of people with language dominance, familiar with culture and potentially useful for the future of bilateral relations." "China maintains a strategic interest in the relationship, even if it does not express it with great visibility. And for a country like Sao Tome, any small help can have a significant impact," he concluded. Reports of four Sao Tomers who followed courses in China Denise, Lucineidy, Reginaldo, and Aithysa grew up under the sign of an alliance with Taiwan, until life and academic path were redefined by the rupture of diplomatic ties between Sao Tome and Taipei in 2016. Denise Aragão Fortes still remembers her hand to Tsai Ing-Wen. It was November 2016, the day of Africa in Taiwan was celebrated, and the official was attended at the time. It is very likely that behind the scenes would already outline the end of diplomacy between Taiwan and Sao Tome and Principe, but for this student of International Relations at the University of Ming Chuan, in Taoyuan, North Taiwanese, the news, who arrived a month after these celebrations, on December 21, was a surprise. “There was no rumors, nothing,” recalls Lusa Denise, now 29, working in marketing and living in Almada, Portugal. When the secondary finished, also the bonds between the island and the African nation, agreed in 1997, had just reached the age of adult. There was “very closeness” between the parts, with Taiwanese friendships in the family. Normality shaken this December 2016. Studying with a scholarship granted by Taipei, Denise and other St.-Tome students in Taiwan was given the option of continuing studies, without financial assistance, or being transferred to China as scholarships. Being at the end of the academic course, Denise remained in Taoyuan. Most, however, changed geography, university and life. Country “full of opportunities” Lucineidy Almeida, now 28, saw the arrival in Tianjin, northern China, as "a new restart" in a "country full of opportunities." Attending the second year of biotechnology in Taichung, this native of Santo António had some difficulty in following the degree in Mandarin. A limitation that would eventually surpass, evaluates today, but in China, had the possibility of studying in English pharmaceutical sciences. He says he learned of the diplomatic break through social networks and, like all students who spoke to Lusa, left criticism of conducting the process, with “many uncertainties”, information given “on time”, “a feeling of disrespect”, and, in the middle, the suspension of the bags. Two months after the announcement, he landed in Hong Kong, where he treated his visa, although he still unaware of what his final destination. Only upon arrival in Beijing was he told that he went to Tianjin, recalls Lucineidy, living today in Portugal, in Cacém, and working as an English and Portuguese interpreter in the medical field. Regarding the diplomatic interruption, it notes that "from what was perceived at the time", it was "a monetary question": "in the sense that China offered more [to Sao Tomé] than Taiwan at the time could provide." The São Tome Prime Minister of the time, Patrice Trovoada, considered the unilateral break of relations as “the right”, taking into account the authorities' view of the country's development. "We decided the principle of joining one China and when adhering implies the cut of relations with Taiwan. The international scenario 20 years ago, not the same as today," he added. But the new political order did not take students to advance in the academic career. Aithysa Ramos, 32, is still in Beijing, where, after leaving Taiwan, she concluded the master's degree in business management. If this morning of 2016, the story had not taken this course, would probably have been in Taiwan, where he had lived seven years ago. At the time, it now remembers the English education teacher, was “devastated and angry”: “It was like my second home, I passed [part of] my adolescence, growth phases”. Reginaldo was in the second year of Business Management at the University of Yuan Ze, Taoyuan, when he stayed to the news. He realized that he “had no power” to change the course of history. The initial shock, assumes today, was really the cold. Despite admitting "it was" always a process of doubts, "China, where he moved two months after the cut of relationships," it was a surprise for the better. " “Because I was still here, not coming back, I can say yes, it was the best thing that happened,” he says.

item.title: Dengue Fever | Authorities warn of the risk of imported cases
item.description:
Macau is facing a “high risk” period of imported cases of dengue fever and chikungunya. The warning was reiterated yesterday at a joint conference on health services and the institute for municipal affairs. Last year's dengue fever cases have been the highest of the last two decades
Health services (SS) and the Institute for Municipal Affairs (AMIs) joined yesterday to alert the population to the growing risk of imported cases of dengue fever and chikungunya fever, given that the summer period is synonymous with more travel and travel. At a press conference, Leong Iek Hou, doctor and head of the SS disease prevention and control center, said that "there was an increase in cases of dengue fever and chikungunya fever in neighboring regions, which is a high risk to Macao." In addition, he added, "we know that we are in the summer time, there is an increase in the number of Macao residents who travel abroad, or tourists traveling to Macao, factors that may increase the risk of disease." Thus, “the risk of cases [fever] in Macau is high,” said the official. Leong Iek Hams advanced some numbers, having said that until Sunday, 2,285 confirmed fever cases were reported, 2,100 occurred only in Shunde district. In the case of Macao, between 2013 and 2019 there were “two to three imported cases of chikungunya fever, all from Southeast Asia”, but in recent years it has increased, although there are no serious cases. Leong Iek Hou also highlighted the fact that, last Friday, Macau registered the first imported case of this year's Chikungunya fever. According to a statement issued by the SS that same day, the patient is a 61 -year -old man, resident and resident in the Cheng I building, on Avenida do Conselheiro Borja. Between July 8 and 17, the patient moved to Shunde district in Foshan, with the aim of visiting family members. However, they describe the SS, on the morning of the 17th “began to present symptoms such as fever, headaches, muscle and joint aches, among others”, having returned Macao and sought medical treatment at the Conde de São Januário hospital center. On the 18th, the public health laboratory confirmed the presence of the Chikungunya virus, with a positive result. To date, the patient has kept stable. Since the beginning of the year and until July 19, the city of Foshan recorded a total of 1,873 confirmed cases of chikungunya fever, of which 1,790 are from Shunde district, focusing mainly on the villages of Lecong, Beijiao, Chenncun. 49 cases occurred in the district of Chancheng, focusing mainly on the sub-district of Shiwanzhen, Zumiao and Zhangcha; While 34 cases were detected in the Nanhai district, focusing mainly on the Guicheng sub-district. A dengue of the worst As for dengue fever cases, Leong Iek Hama pointed out that by 2024 the occurrence of this disease "it was relatively more severe when compared to the last 20 years, as 38 cases of dengue were recorded, nine locations." "This year were registered eight cases imported of dengue fever, being a place," said the SS official. It was also said that it is possible to lock and combat these infections through, for example, the cleaning of stagnant water, which attracts the proliferation of mosquitoes. “This year we have done more work to eliminate mosquitoes with Jardim Camões,” said Fong Vai Seng, head of the AMI Environmental Hygiene Department. "We can say that we can eliminate mosquitoes that can be carriers of the virus [causer of fevers], avoiding its transmission. In any of the forms we are at the peak of cases, and residents and tourists may be carried to the virus, so we have to be alert. We have done a series of cleaning work to avoid the source of mosquitoes proliferation, and until June [since the year] we have supervised about 7,400 spaces." It was mentioned. Inspection actions took place in 140 places that are considered “black points” with regard to the proliferation of mosquitoes, and between January and June this year, 1,220 chemical elimination actions of these insects were made. Both entities promise to work side by side in cleaning land. “AMI and SS have a mechanism for monitoring and treatment of hygiene problems in private spaces or unoccupied land. Whenever the ss find that there is danger to public health, or in case of an emergency situation, and whenever it is not possible to contact the landowners, AMI will collaborate in removing containers or zones with stagnant waters that may serve as proliferation of Mosquitoes, ”was said at the press conference. Leong Iek Hou also explained that there are not yet many places in Macao where tests can be done that disapprove of the infection. "There are not many medical institutions that have this type of test available. When clinics or private hospitals want to take the test for the displaying of transmitted diseases, these institutions send us blood samples and we do the tests in our public health laboratory for free for various types of fever, given that symptoms are similar." Hong Kong on Alert The risk alert of more imported cases of these two types of fever has also arrived in Hong Kong. According to the South China Morning Post newspaper on Thursday, several experts warn of the high risk of infections taking into account the outbreak registered in the city of Foshan, belonging to Guangdong province. Wong Hoi-Kei, a senior doctor and head of the Guangdong Center for Health Protection, said that "although outbreaks do not occur in popular cities among Hong Kong inhabitants, frequent trips between Guangdong and Hong Kong mean the risk of imported cases is higher." Also quoted by the same newspaper, doctor Joseph Tsang Kay-Yan, an infectious illness expert, said it is possible that Hong Kong will have imported cases that could lead to sporadic infections, and explained that the two types of fevers have similar symptoms, but with a big difference: with chikungunya fever, patients feel joint pain. Wong Hoi-Kei said that several cleaning actions are being developed to avoid proliferation of mosquitoes and to inform the population for symptoms. "We have the ability to reduce the risk of an outbreak triggered by imported cases as much as possible," Wong said. This year alone, and according to data released by SCMP, more than 220,000 cases of chikungunya fever were recorded worldwide in 14 locations, including the Taiwan and Singapore regions. The latest cases of this type of fever in Hong Kong had occurred in 2019, with only 11 patients. According to the SS, the means of transmission and measures to prevent and control chikungunya fever and dengue fever are identical, both transmitted by bite of mosquitoes of the "Aedes albopictus" species, which usually reproduce in small amounts of stagnant, clean and stopped water. Given the recent passage through Macao do Typhoon Wipha, the authorities yesterday remembered the importance of cleaning these spaces. Chikungunya fever is a viral disease and has a period of incubation of three to eight days, which can vary between two and 12 days, with fever symptoms and then joint pain in body areas such as wrists, knees, ankles and fingertips. Two to three days later rashes appear. "The whole course of the disease usually lasts five to seven days, being the state of health of most patients considered light," explains the SS.

They could also “be transformed into creative and artistic spaces or in fact propose new wood buildings along the waterline, with various uses and that can generate value to the Coloane community, contributing to Macao's cultural and economic diversification”. Hopes Filipe Afonso highlights the process of revitalization and recovery of the Lai Chi Vun shipyard zone as a “initiative with immense historical and cultural value, which refers to the rich tradition of the region's shipbuilding”. item.title: AL | New Regiment prohibits deputies from disseminating content of the commissions
item.description:
With the new Hemiciclo Regiment approved yesterday, the deputies are prohibited from publicizing the subjects discussed in the meetings of the permanent committees, except for their presidents and secretaries. The subject generated debate yesterday in the Assembly regarding the limits of what may or may not be said. Pereira Coutinho voted against this article
The deputies of the Legislative Assembly (AL) are now prohibited from disseminating what is discussed at the Hemiciclo Commission meetings, "anywhere," with the exception of its president and secretary. These usually disclose the content of the meetings at a press conference after their holding, and this will keep up. This new regulation arises after the vote and discussion, in general and specialty, the alteration to the al. It was one of the most discussed topics in yesterday's debate, with the deputies arguing on what can or can not be said, having José Pereira Coutinho voted against this concrete article. The disclosure of information from the meetings, which serves to analyze in the specialty proposals of law and always steering at the closed door, was something that was not yet regulated. Coutinho began by asking if he could disclose the information "during the plenary meeting", for example, having said that "he never heard of any deputy who had violated that duty." "There have been meetings in the past where the secretaries warned about the information that should not be disclosed and nothing has been said. We are only 33 deputies and we should think of the possibility of revealing what was discussed, because it is difficult to define borders about what can or can not be revealed and this will give rise to many discussions later," he said. The legislator also pointed out that "it can be difficult to execute this norm" and that "the principle of transparency" should be followed. Ho Ion Sang, who presided over to the commission that analyzed the new Al Regiment, explained that "the content of the meetings is subject to the duty of confidentiality and this matter was clarified." "The content can be said by the president of the commissions after the meetings, at the press conferences, and journalists can ask questions. In practice remains as always happened and that has given good results," he said. Meet the meetings Another point addressed, whether or not the permanent committees were held at the closed door, and Pereira Coutinho defended the opening to the public like what happens in Hong Kong. The AL regiment does not prohibit open meetings, but this always depends on a prior deliberation. But iau Teng Pio, deputy, advised against the opening of the meetings. "The purpose of the closed -door meetings is so that members of the government, advisors and deputies can argue at ease even if there is no final decision. If there is even the meetings at the open door do not help and is not beneficial for the law proposal." Kou Hoi In, president of AL, recalled that “the spirit of the norm has not been changed” and that everything will stay in it, only the ban on what deputies cannot refer outside the commissions. "The reserved character of permanent committees is so that everyone can speak freely and if any deputy says this or that can spoil sensations of injustice in society to deputies and this cannot happen. We have to protect deputies and ensure confidentiality." At yesterday's meeting, there was also the discussion of the duty of the deputy to participate in all permanent committees, even in those to which he does not belong. Several deputies spoke of the need for better coordination of meetings agendas. "In the future there may be more practical coordination because there are many meetings and proposals of law. We can schedule the meetings so that there are more deputies," he said. Moreover, the new Al regiment prohibits deputies by "clothing or signs, banners, signs or other objects that have offensive content or political provocation, or undermine the dignity of the AL".

item.title: About 97 percent of Spanish adolescents victim of sexual aggression on the internet
item.description: About 97 percent of teenagers in Spain is the victim of some kind of sexual violence on the internet, warned yesterday the Non-Governmental Organization (NGO) Save the Children. The NGO released a report yesterday with the title “Networks that hold. Sexual exploitation of childhood and adolescence in digital environments”, which elaborated with the European Association for Digital Transition and which includes official data and an inquiry to over 1,000 Spanish young people aged 18 and 21. According to the study, 97 percent of these young people said they were victims of some kind of sexual violence on the Internet during adolescence, including contacts from adults for sexual purposes, unauthorized diffusion of intimate images or blackmail and threats to send intimate and sexual content. Another type of violence enhanced in the report is the use of artificial intelligence tools to create sexual content from a real image of adolescents or children (content known as 'Deepfake' or 'Ultra counterfeits'). According to the study, one in five young Spaniards was the victim of the creation and diffusion of these 'Deepfake' during adolescence, namely with sharing by another person, to third parties, and without consent, of their own nudity images, elaborated through artificial intelligence. "The internet, social networks and technologies not only facilitate capture and exposure to sexual exploitation -related risks, but can be the means by which these violence against boys and girls are committed and allow their perpetuation," said Save the Children, in a statement released from the study published yesterday. Starter Social networks are the most frequent way for aggressors to start contacts with the teenage victims, with the study also highlighting online video games in the case of boys. After this first contact, they move to applications and messages of messages such as WhatsApp, Telegram or Discord. Girls are the ones that most denounce to be pressured to send intimate content (28.5 percent from 18.4 percent of boys), with the study revealing that all victims had shared personal or intimate information on the internet during childhood and adolescence. According to the study, only 50 percent of young people when they were smaller considered contact with unknown people one of the main risks of the internet and only 32.9 percent mentioned as dangerous the consented send of intimate images to adults. On the other hand, 70 percent states that it has not seen as a risk, in adolescence, the manipulation of photographs and videos with artificial intelligence. item.title: Maternity | “Independent Entity” studies license increase
item.description:
The government has been responsible for a “third independent entity” of elaborating a study on increasing maternity leave and annual holidays. In five months, Dsal made almost 900 inspections of combating illegal work, which resulted in the punishment of only three employer entities
The Secretary for Economics and Finance, Tai Kin IP, had already indicated that the government was working to adjust the number of maternity leave and annual holidays in a plenary session of the Legislative Assembly. The acceleration of the process was confirmed by the Director of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL), Chan Un Tong, who revealed that the government has commissioned a third independent entity to proceed with an inquiry and study on the increase in labor standards, namely the issue of maternity leave, currently fixed in 70 days, and vacation. The Macao Law establishes the annual vacation number paid in six days, a rule that has not changed for four decades and many companies have ignored more generous contracts for workers. Public officials enjoy 22 days of paid vacation. However, the director of Dsal stresses the need to “reach consensus between the parts of employers and workers”, through the Permanent Council for Social Concertation (CPCs). To this end, “considering that the revision of labor legislation involves several social factors”, the executive emphasizes that it is necessary to “consider the general interests of Macao” and make a public consultation. The point of situation on the reform of labor laws was advanced by the director of Dsal in response to a written interpellation of Leong Hong Sai. A lot One of the unavoidable themes when it comes to market and labor laws in Macau is the issue of non-resident workers (TNR). The residents' deputy did not let the opportunity to request the improvement of the inspection to irregularities involving TNR. In this respect, Chan Un Tong indicated that between January and May this year, DSAL made a total of 874 inspections, which resulted in the application of administrative sanctions to 856 people due to illegal work "(including" exercise of duties in place/ for employer different from authorized "," exercise of alien functions to authorized ", illegal worker and work on their own)". However, despite the nearly 900 inspections made, only three employing entities were “punished with ancillary sanctions”, such as the revocation of contracting authorizations regarding 10 non-resident workers. The three employers were also prevented for six months from requesting new TNR hiring authorizations. The issue of “voluntary overtime” and the right to rest was also mentioned. The director of DSAL recalled that the law defines that the normal working period cannot exceed 48 hours per week, with this number of hours only the maximum weekly limit of the normal working period. However, the law opens the hypothesis of agreement between employer and worker for length of service, "the employer should assure the worker 10 consecutive hours of rest per day, in a total of not less than 12 hours."

item.title: Travel alert system now includes 110 countries and destinations
item.description: The government extended the number of countries and regions covered by the travel alert system, according to the information released yesterday by the Directorate of Tourism Services (STD). With the changes, 110 countries and regions are classified. The latest changes have made destinations such as Iran, Lebanon and Syria are classified with alert level 3, which means authorities completely advise travel. "The level of threat to personal security is extreme. Macao residents who plan to travel or are at the destination must be aware of the severity of the situation and the official assistance that can be provided," he was explained. "It is advised to avoid traveling and, in certain situations will be advised to abandon the destination," he was added. At the same time, Pakistan was ranked with alert level 2, with the authorities to advise on “non-essential” trips. "The level represents an increase in the threat to personal security. Macao residents who plan to travel or are at the destination must reconsider the trip at this time," was explained on this level. Level The warning system also has level 1, the lighter, for situations where there is “a threat to personal security” and the authorities advise residents traveling to these destinations who are careful and stay alert. The travel warning system does not prohibit travel, but may have an impact on travel insurance coverage. Therefore, STD "recommends residents of Macao to travel before traveling in time to travel insurance, with the option of coverage for the MSAR travel alert system, international emergency evacuation, as well as verifying with their insurers in case of doubt about the terms and conditions of their coverage."

item.title: FSS | Almost half of employers did not pay contributions
item.description: The Social Security Fund (FSS) indicated yesterday that until Sunday 46 percent of employers had not yet paid the mandatory contributions of the Social Security regime, for the second quarter of this year to its workers. The percentage concerns about 11,600 employers. The FSS warns that, since contributions must be paid by the end of this month, in case of late payment, employers need to pay default interest and fine. Failure to pay the hiring fees of non-resident workers, in addition to a fine, may also lead to the revocation of authorization to hire non-residents. Predicting a great influx in recent days to pay contributions, FSS calls on employers and residents to use the platform for companies and associations or the Macao Single Account Application.

One of the steps to develop the sector will be to unite all sectors of the society of Macao to "seriously implement the spirit consecrated in the important speeches given by Mr. President XI Jinping during his visit to Macao." item.title: Female
item.description:
Recently, news that circulated online, reported that the “mutual help society to the co-babling of women” in the UK, headquartered in London, had received more than 50 women all in their 50s. Mutual aid society only receives women who are alone. It is an exclusive space reserved only for women, where men have no place. The goal is to provide these women a space where they can live independently, to help each other and live with dignity and autonomy, in a more advanced phase of life. These exclusive spaces are apartments that can have one, two or three bedrooms, properties of the mutual help society. The highest price of a 3 bedroom apartment is £ 400,000, about $ 4.2 million from Hong Kong (HKD). Women can buy them according to their financial abilities. Mutual care include financial management and domestic group maintenance, etc. Women can participate in different groups depending on their interests and their skills that put the service of collective life. For example, the group may be in charge of hiring staff to deliver meals to sick women and take care of those who are no longer self-sufficient. If group members are unable to perform these tasks on their own they can ask other residents for help. A lady who lives in the mutual help society said that this model gave him the courage to face aging. The reason for the emergence of mutual aid societies for the co-bibing of women is that they stop working earlier to take care of their children and family and their economic condition and the social circle are more limited. But even more significant is the greatest female longevity. If you live alone at an advanced age, your situation deserves more attention. Guardian announced that since 1997, 1 in 6 British has been over 65 years old. From 2017, this percentage increased to 1 in 5 and it is estimated that in 2037, out of 4 British 1 will be over 65 years old. This trend reflects the aging of the British population. In Japan, more than 76,000 people living alone die at home unaccompanied and more than 21,000 are only discovered 8 days after death. Therefore, a place where a group of older people live together can avoid loneliness and the possibility of dying alone. In the society of our day, there is a tendency to live alone. One of the attractions of this situation is the decrease in the financial burden. Those who live in a family have more expenses and still have to take care of their parents. Singles have a more reliable life. As mentioned above, the price of a three -bedroom mutual help society apartment around 4.2 million HKD, which can represent an affordable amount. Another advantage of being single is the freedom that you enjoy. Of course this freedom implies abdicating a family life, the possibility of having romantic relationships and children. The traditional Chinese concept of “raising children to ensure old age and storing grain to avoid hunger” (養兒防老 ， 積穀防飢) cannot be applied to singles. Should we choose to be single or should we organize a family life with children? There is no single answer to this question. It depends on how individuals weigh the pros and cons of various aspects of their preferences before making a decision. In either case, we should think carefully before opting. Despite everything, this decision will affect our whole life. If after 40, a woman wants to suddenly found a family and being a mother may have difficulty reaching this goal. When a person reaches the initial phase of aging, he can still move freely and have full use of his mental abilities, so living in a mutual aid society does not represent any problem. As age advances, physical condition is gradually deteriorated, intellectual abilities begin to slow down and diseases reduce mobility and communication capacity. For example, the elderly with Alzheimer's need to have professional care. Are these professionals present in mutual help societies to solve these problems? There is no detailed information on the subject. However, to ensure appropriate care for the elderly is more appropriate than being provided by professionals. For mutual aid societies to work in full, they must pay close attention to this subject. Should we, as a society, foster the appearance of more mutual help societies to widen these services to more people? To answer the question, we must try to understand social needs and carefully analyze whether there is any overlap in the roles of mutual aid societies and the elderly service agencies. A decision that can only be made after further research.
