item.title: The new panorama of international political economy and the economic development of the global southern
item.description: An academic from the University of Fudan analyzes the megatendencies and concrete challenges that the global south has to face in a deep change overview. (continuation of the previous number) Part II In part I of this comment in two parts, I stressed that the general panorama of international political economy (hereinafter designated 'PPE') has changed dramatically, thanks to a series of seismic events and important developments. As such, all global southern countries, for which economic development remains a central task, must operate in a deeply different overview to achieve economic development. In this part II, I will highlight the main megatendencies and the most concrete challenges, two sets of restrictions that global southern countries need to face in the coming years. By megatendencies, I refer to the contrary winds to which the Global Southern countries will have to adapt, because we cannot combat them easily. As for the concrete challenges, I concur with specific domains and issues that the Global South Countries will have to face in the coming years. Megatendencies Two commercial and technological blocks, although they are not totally dissociated The first important megate is that, most likely, the world will see two large commercial and technological blocks centered on the US (plus the EU?) AND CHINA. After Trump 1.0, Biden and now Trump 2.0, dissociation between the US and China has been accelerating, and as soon as the level of dissociation reaches a threshold, it will be extremely difficult to go back to the old days. Of course, both blocks will not be fully dissociated: both for the US and EU, economic interdependence with China is not easily replaceable. Even in technologies, the US and the EU may not be able to completely challenge China. Thus, there will continue to be a wide interdependence between the two blocks. However, this will not prevent the US and China from disacting each other substantially from each other. Moreover, although neither EU nor China will reach to the point of demanding that other countries negotiate with them alone, the US may impose such a requirement from time to time. This possibility creates uncertainty and significant costs for all your business partners, including the EU. Once again, this new cold war between the US and China would be drastically different from the old Cold War between the US and the Soviet Union. In the previous cold war, the Soviet Union has never been an important commercial partner for most countries. On the other hand, China is one of the leading business partners of most countries in the world. Regionalism with interregionalism At least since World War II, regionalism, that is, regional integration with a level of economic and institutionalized political cooperation, has been a fundamental anchor for regional stability and economic development. Regions with robust regionalism projects can more effectively resist external shocks and external pressure, while those who do not have them are vulnerable to external pressure or even the intrusion of great extra-regional powers. Not surprisingly, after World War II, many regions and subregions have had at least some kind of regionalism project, often with the European project as a model. The above is not new. What is new is that, with the first megate in force, interregionalism will become even more crucial, especially because the WTO system is poorly working. Thus, emerging dialogues and partnerships, such as the EU and the Macusor (Southern Common Market), the Association of Southeast Asia Nations (Asean) and the Gulf Cooperation Council (CCG), Asean and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO), the EU and the African Union (UA), and Asean and AU, will be important developments to accompany. However, the EU is no longer envy to other regions and its regionalism projects: the EU has lost its once seemingly invincible aura. The inability of the EU and European leaders in preventing conflict between Russia and Ukraine certainly did not help: EU and European leaders basically left Russia and Ukraine go to an sleepless war, despite the warning of the Crisis in Georgia in 2008 and Putin's discourse at the Munich security conference in 2007. prevent intra-regional conflicts. Moreover, even for European countries, excessive bureaucracy, rules and formalities in Brussels inevitably prevent innovation and agility, necessary in times of rapid change and major turbulence. Perhaps a less institutionalized or bureaucratic approach is more appropriate, at least for Global Southern countries. Finally, it is worth noting that regionalism needs the main countries in a region to work together. Thus, regions with intense rivalries between major countries tend to suffer. Regions such as the Middle East, the southern Asia, the Eurasian Union and, perhaps, central and eastern Europe are disappointing examples if not tragic. In this sense, it is quite remarkable that China, Japan and South Korea have so far been able to maintain a more or less stable relationship, despite its troubled history and territorial disputes. Growth and innovation in the age of mobile technology and AI In part I, I highlighted the fact that new current technologies, especially mobile communication, satellite images, artificial intelligence (AI), automation and drones, bring a totally new dynamic to economic development as they have the potential to empower all sectors. If so, much of growth and innovation in the future will occur in this new technological age. Most importantly, innovation now depends on the flow and instant connection of information and knowledge, both enhanced by AI. At the same time, economic development, which depends on trade, now depends on the timely and safe conclusion of transactions, enhanced by mobile communication and mobile payment. Thus, to achieve economic development, the most critical task for Global Southern (and other places) countries is to build two types of informational infrastructure, as well as traditional physical infrastructure such as highways, railways and ports. The first type is the information infrastructure that can facilitate the flow and connection of information and knowledge. The second is the mobile communication infrastructure and mobile payment that can facilitate the timely and secure conclusion of the transactions. Countries without these essential infrastructure systems will be seriously impaired in the coming decades. Concrete challenges: domains and questions All global southern countries face unique challenges. But they will also face some common challenges. Although the challenges are unlimited, below are the three that I consider most urgent and one more distant. The state's capacity remains the pillar, with institutions and policies as state instruments According to a theoretical framework that I developed in my book (The Institutional Foundation of Economic Development), the capacity of the state, the institutional system and socioeconomic policies (including industrial policies) form the new development triangle (NDT), with state capacity being the most fundamental of the three components. Without a minimum level of state capacity, a state cannot really do much, even if you want it. Although I believe many Global South Countries have reached a minimum level of state capacity, they are far from strong states. After all, state construction is a slow and cumulative process: Rome was not built in one day. Thus, state construction will remain a perennial task for many global southern countries for a long time. State capacities can be understood as consisting of four main dimensions: coercion (such as violence control), extraction (such as tax collection), provision (such as infrastructure construction and service provision) and information -based leadership (such as decision -making based on proper information collected in the country). Apparently each of the four main dimensions requires a sustained effort. In addition, the four dimensions form a system. The crucial point, however, is that each dimension requires a reasonably capable bureaucracy. As such, the most central task for many global southern countries is to build a capable bureaucracy. Sailing between the two blocks Even if we believe that economic development has been driven mainly by internal developments, the dynamics of the international system restrict state actions, including its search for economic development. After all, no country can achieve economic development without trade. Thus, when international volatility increases, countries face even more challenges to sustain economic development. This may be even more true to global southern countries: they now need to develop under heavier restrictions imposed by globalization and the international system. With the world now divided into two major commercial blocks, this becomes even more difficult: all global southern countries will have to navigate between the two blocks, except those who sell mainly with a block. For example, if the US and EU bet on more protectionism, what will this mean to the global south? There is no miraculous solution to this navigation task. However, it is possible to observe three useful points. First, it is desirable to negotiate with both blocks. Second, if you are forced to choose, it is better to be in a position to resist, perhaps within a regionalist project (see below). Third, if you are forced to choose and cannot resist, it is better to negotiate with the block that offers you the most advantages. IPE: From OCED-Centente to the Global-Centers South The economy of dominant development was largely kidnapped by the neoclassical economy. As such, it is inherently unable to provide the global south an adequate understanding of how to achieve economic development. The causes are two. First, the dominant development economy is largely rooted in Western/Anglo-Saxon experience, enshrined by Douglass North and his followers. Second, the economy of dominant development, with its neoclassical roots, has largely ignored both internal and international politics. The task of producing new knowledge for economic development in the Global South thus falls on the shoulders of IPE. Unfortunately, since its birth, around 1950-70, IPE Orthodox has also been a western cerebrospinal or oced-decent. This was perhaps understandable: immediately after World War II, there was not much trade between OCED countries and non -OCED countries, and even less among non -OCED countries themselves. Moreover, although IPE has 'political economy' in its name, it has never considered economic development as its main task. All IPE's fundamental texts focused on commerce, the monetary system, the capital flow, regional integration (mainly centered on EU), the regime and hegemonic stability within the OECD countries. In fact, none of IPE's fundamental texts studied economic development, much less that of the global southern. Thus, we need to get out of the neoliberalism and Washington consensus forces shirt, which was more or less supported by the OECD-centered IPE and produced by the OECD and the developmental economy within the Anglo-Saxon sphere. If the global southern countries intend to achieve economic development in a new IPE panorama, we urgently need new knowledge on the subject. More critically, the Global Southern countries themselves have to produce much of this new knowledge. In short, we need knowledge from the global southern, over the global south and to the global south. Here I would risk arguing that my new development triangle (NDT) provides a powerful and applicable picture to understand economic development in the global south, because my picture focuses on the global south. As I stated, the most critical factor that shape economic performance over time and between countries is the (bad) allocation of factors of political decisions: who, under which institutions and power relations (both national and international), decides to employ which knowledge and other factors of production to produce what. The task that ahead is to reach the thorough work of empirical investigation with the real experience of economic development in the global south. Academic and professionals from the Global South, debate, participate and join! Building a fairer international order: from knowledge to the rules As I understood above, we are living a new era of geopolitical agitation. This means that we are now in an "interregnum". Paraphrasing Gramsci, the old West -centered international order is now in ruins, but a new one is still born. The positive side is that "a wide variety of morbid symptoms appears" in this interregnum, it is also an opening for the construction of a fairer order, not centered on the West but more inclusive. Order, like Rome, cannot be built on a day. Even more important, every order is made of rules or institutions. Since rules are simply coded knowledge, only with concrete knowledge can the global south go from knowledge to the rules and, finally, to order. In other words, only if scholars and global south professionals can produce concrete knowledge that establishes the specific rules and directions of the future international order, they may compete, negotiate and cooperate with the West in defining the rules of the future order. However, knowledge is not sufficient without power. To transform knowledge into rules, it is necessary to power to create and enforce the rules. Thus, a struggle is approaching: there will be a struggle for the power to create and enforce new rules between the West and the global south, and none of the sides will easily give in to the other the power to create rules without fighting. For this power struggle, the global southern countries need to come together. Fortunately, this struggle is not entirely zero: when the rules within the future order are fairer, both the West and the global south will benefit. Thus, to shape a fairer international order, the West and the Global South will also have to work together. The future has not yet been written, but it is being written now.

item.title: “Art Macao” | Galeria Hwa presents work by Zhang Zhanzhan
item.description:
The “Art Macao - International Art Biennial of Macau 2025” arrived in the city and with it various cultural initiatives. One is the new exhibition in the HWA gallery at Lisbon Macau, which reveals the work of artist Zhang Zhanzhan. "Hi, luck!" It is evident until September
It is around the theme of luck that rotates the new exhibition of the HWA gallery, patent at Lisbon Macau. “Hi, Luck!”, With works by Zhang Zhanzhan, this year's edition of “Art Macao: International Art Biennial of Macau 2025” and is available for public visits until September. According to an official note about the event, this exhibition is held in partnership with Artdeport and presents the work of the well-known Chinese contemporary artist. This is one of the "collateral exhibitions" of the Biennial, which has as its theme "Hey, what brings it here?", Exploring the ideas of "seeing, enjoying and embracing the luck of art that transforms the chaos of life in a significant way." According to the same note, the artist “is known for his philosophical depth and innovative vision”, and the collections and exhibitions he has made throughout Asia “are observations of daily life with existential contemplation, showing Zhang's characteristic fusion between visual brilliance and intellectual resonance to present luck as a significant human experience”. There According to the official page of “Art Macao”, Zhang Zhanzhan believes that “luck is not a fortuitous gift, but a disposition of mind marked by a keen conscience, an active search and a sincere welcome in daily life.” Thus, the works present in the HWA Gallery “captures fragments of time, guiding him to 'see luck'-the subtle brightness in the morning fog”, or to “grasp luck”, exploring the idea of a “flying in fleeting meetings”, or to “embrace luck”, in which the public can, by visualizing the artistic work, “intertwining the warmth of life with the world”. Thus, in this exhibition, "art serves as a flashlight, illuminating the meaning in chaos and together exploring the true essence of luck." Zhang Zhanzhan was born in Hebei in 1982, having graduated from the Nanjing University School of Arts of Arts in 2008. One of the latest exhibitions he held was in 2023, named “Out of This World”, patent at the Yinchuan Museum of Contemporary Art. The previous year, the artist debuted "Post Me Generation: How to Write About Young Artists" in Beijing. Last year, and also in Beijing, Zhang Zhanzhan held “You’re Always on My Mind” at Beijing's well -known Art District.

item.title: FRC | Timor-Leste images exhibited until August
item.description:
It is called “a trip to the land of crocodile in the year of the serpent” and is the new exhibition of photography in the Rui Cunha Foundation, by Cristiana Figueiredo. The images are added to Bibi Ain's texts. There are 25 photographs of “people, places and things”, on a trip full of emotions
The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) inaugurates today, from 6.30 pm, a photographic exhibition about Timor-Leste entitled “A Trip to the Land of Crocodile in the year of the serpent”, with images by Cristiana Figueiredo and texts by Bibi Ain. This initiative "results from a trip of discovery, for one, and from reunion to the other at the beginning of this year." With the subtitle “People. Places. Things”, the show includes 25 photographs that visually reveal what texts describe about the emotions impregnated in the small details of the journey. According to the authors, cited by a FRC note, "at the beginning of 2025 we embarked on a trip to Timor-Leste," was "the discovery of home roots, the hug of the loved ones, the reappearance of sweet and fragile memories," or "enter a history book and feel the welcome of the unknown." "The trip was an intimate and inspiring lighthouse in Timor-Leste, where seemingly disparate perspectives came together to create new perspectives, about the people and places of this wonderful small country," reveals the pair of travelers in his manifesto. Cristiana Figueiredo further states that "behind the lens, I witnessed the transformation of timid behaviors into generous tropical smiles that revealed intimate glimpses and fleeting ”. Stories and Images The author says she found, on this trip, "a landscape that surrendered to the capture of the window of a moving car on a bumpy road, or a quiet moment with her feet buried in the hot sand, caressed by the sound of waves to beat." Thus, “sharing this unforgettable experience through the photographs of this exhibition is my love letter to Timor-Leste,” he said. Cristiana Figueiredo's life is a tapestry woven on three continents, according to her biography. “Born in Angola, his years of formation in Portugal passed. In the quiet afternoons after school, the parents' art encyclopedias aroused his passion for the arts, an early fascination that inspired her to take several short courses in the history of art, design and painting, and to devote himself to photography, throwing the foundations for her creative path,” he reads. Upon completion of the degree in Sociology at the University of Porto, Cristiana's life took her to Macau, where, in the last 23 years, she was a local entrepreneur in the food and drinks, having become her creativity to graphic design, branding and interior design. Recently, Cristiana has become full-time visual creator, exploring various means, continually capturing the world around her and reimaginating it through her lenses, brushes and computer. Everywhere In turn, Bibi Ain's life is a woven tapestry between three countries: Timor-Leste, Australia and China. Born in Timor-Leste, he spent his years of formation in Australia. Studied Art, History of Art, Cinema and Television, English and Italian literature, architecture, business management and, finally, tourist management. It served your country as a diplomat in the last thirty years. Bibi Ain, stage name, derives from the word tetum “bibi” (goat) and “ain” (foot). “Like a goat who jumps everywhere with enthusiasm in search of a new adventure, my family dubbed me to reflect my thirst to travel,” he explains in the same note. The images and texts will be exposed until August 2, 2025.

item.title: Lisbon | Vítor Marreiros protagoniza shows “Camões five zero zero”
item.description:
Vítor Hugo Marreiros presents from next Saturday an exhibition in Lisbon at Galeria Passavite. It is “Camões five zero zero”, which celebrates the 500th anniversary of the birth of the one who is considered the largest poet in the Portuguese language
It is called “Camões five zero zero” and, more than being the name of Vítor Hugo Marreiros's new exhibition, is an initiative that shows the work of the artist and designer Macaense in Portugal. The inauguration takes place in downtown Lisbon, at the Galeria Passavite, next Saturday from 18:30. The exhibition that will be evident in this space until August 30. According to a press release, the show “marks the 500th anniversary of the birth of Luís de Camões”, starting from an original idea by graphic designer Henrique Silva, better known as Bibra, who has lived in Macao for many years. Thus, what is done in “Camões five zero zero” is a “contemporary and symbolic reading of the poet's figure through the posters Victor Marreiros has created over three decades to mark June 10 in Macao”. In this exhibition, Camões “from the usual context” is removed, the poet's image with new interpretations mirrored in “graphic freedom, humor and critical spirit, in a series that is, simultaneously, memory and creation” emerges. An unprecedented show The exhibition arrives in Lisbon thanks to the support of IPOR - Portuguese Institute of the East and Herdade do Perdigão. This is the first time Vitor Hugo Marreiros exposes his work in Portugal. It should be noted that Camões is a constant presence in one of the works by which Marreiros has been better known in recent times: the June 10 posters promoted by the House of Portugal in Macau and which are designed by themselves, in a constant mix of elements that refer to Portuguese. Vítor Hugo Marreiros has a career of over 45 years dedicated to the visual arts, scenography and graphic design, which was internationally recognized with more than 200 awards and distinctions. The artist and designer was born in Macao in 1960, and is a founding member of the CAC - Circle of Macao Culture Friends and also the Macao Design Association. Studied, in the 1980s, at the Higher School of Fine Arts of Porto, subsidized by the Cultural Institute, which later worked for several years. It won, from the hands of the government of Macao, still in the years of the Portuguese Administration, the professional merit medal on October 5, 1999. During the exhibition will be available a special edition of screen printing, numbered and signed by the artist, as well as the catalog of the show.

item.title: Macao Art | Works of nine international artists together on exhibition
item.description:
Sands China presents two exhibitions in Macao Art: Macao International Art Biennial, which will bring together works by nine international artists: “Dopamine: Source of Happiness” and “Beyond the Frame: Contemporary International Public Works”. The exhibitions are inaugurated at the end of the month
Sands China will display two exhibitions, part of Macao art programming: Macao International Art Biennial. “Dopamine: Fountain of Happiness” and the “Collateral Shows” “Beyond the Frame: Contemporary International Works” are inaugurated on July 29 and will be on display until October 15th. “Dopamine: Source of Happiness,” which will be evident at the Venetian Macao, will bring together works by nine international contemporary artists from Asia, Europe and the United States: Craig & Karl, local artists Bibi Lei and Hei Lok, Grafflex, Ilya Milstein, Jun Oson, Junni Cheatwood and Song Zhou. Continuing the growing tendency of the aesthetic infantilization of current contemporary art of the region, the works reinterpret characters known worldwide from the “Sesame Street” universe, such as Elmo, Big Bird and Ernie. Sand China points out that "artists explore the vast possibilities of contemporary art, creating distinct styles through the fusion of Roman mythology with the art of dopamine." Up to sesame street Produced by the non -profit organization Sesame Workshop, “Sesame Street” has been a pioneer on children's television for over 50 years, mixing education and entertainment to nourish generations of young minds. Sands China has invited nine artists to reimaginate the spirit and timeless ethics of “sesame street” through a lens loaded with dopamine. “Through vivid colors, boundless imagination and a new mode of interaction between art and public space, the exhibition conveys joy in vibrant tones, inviting visitors to walk and naturally experience the happiness and emotional resonance that art can offer,” says Sands China. On the other hand The collateral show, as the organization designates, “Beyond the Frame: Contemporary International Works”, which will be patent in the Sand Gallery located on the Grand Suites of Hotel Four Seasons, is made up of creations of six main exhibition artists: Hei Lok, Grafflex, Ilya Milstein, Jun Oson, Junni Cheatwood and Song Zhou. The organization points out that the works that will be exhibited in the gallery "break conventional structures through distinct visual languages, employing various ways of expression, such as painting, sculpture, artistic installation and mixed means." Sand Gallery will present more than 60 classical and new masterpieces, which “sail freely between materiality, space and cultural narratives, forging new artistic boundaries”. House silver Among the artists invited to “dopamine: source of happiness”, highlighting two local creators. Born in Macao of Luso-Chinese descent, Bibi Lei is a Tokyo-based contemporary artist who has attracted international attention for his capricious and vivid color painting style. A self -taught breeder, Bibi Lei paints intuitively with his fingers, often portraying a recurring character - “Brave Girl” - which symbolizes innocence and courage, traveling through a dream world full of hope and children's wonder. Law became the first and youngest artist in Macao to reach a sales record at Sotheby's of London, with his work to be sold at 193 percent above the estimated price, marking a significant milestone for Macao's art scene. He is also the first Macao female artist to expose during Basel Art Week at Art Miami. Since 2022, his career has grown rapidly, attracting the attention of collectors from Japan, Europe and Asia. In just two years, he exposed in New York, Paris, London, Los Angeles, Dubai, Tokyo, Seoul and Hong Kong, establishing himself as one of the most promising emerging artists in Asia. Hei Lok, born within an artistic family known in Macau, is a prominent artist, curator and defender of culture. His works of art focus on the local culture and daily life of Macao, characterized by a delicate technique and a rich emotional expression. He exposed in Macao, Hong Kong and Portugal, demonstrating a strong sense of cultural identity. As president of the Society of Artists of Macao and member of the Council of the China Artists Association for two terms, it has long been dedicated to promoting the artistic and cultural exchange between Macau and Tibet, continuing his father's legacy in interregional cooperation. In addition to artistic creation, Lok is also dedicated to artistic education, beginning the “Rainbow Road” youth art campaign that the end of bringing creative inspiration to ethnic minority communities in rural areas.

item.title: CPSP | Two detainees for exploitation of prostitution
item.description: The Public Security Police Corps (CPSP) announced the arrest of two men abroad of a Cotai hotel, as evidence of the crime of exploitation of prostitution. After receiving a complaint for the harassment of people outside a hotel, the CPSP sent agents to the scene and identified two men, one from interior and one from Thailand, the latter being dressed in women's clothes. According to the newspaper or Mun, when he was approached by the authorities, the interior man confessed to raising customers for the man who dressed as a woman. For each client raised, the man could receive up to $ 500 from Hong Kong. In turn, the prostitute charged $ 1,500 to each client. When the authorities moved to the hotel used by the prostitute, they found a third interior man. He confessed to reserving his room that day. The two interior suspects were arrested and sent to the prosecutor. They are indicted for the crime of exploitation of prostitution, which can be punished with a prison sentence that can reach the three years. As for the Thailand National, he was sent to the immigration department, as he used the tourist visa to practice a profession, which is considered an abuse of the type of visa issued.

item.title: CCAC | Bribes have decreased significantly
item.description:
The commissioner against corruption has indicated that “in recent years”, situations of abuse of power and bribes have decreased significantly. The agency led by Ieong Seong points out that current cases are more violations of general duties, such as falsification of attendance records
"With the efforts made over the years, the number of typical cases of corruption in public services involving situations of abuse of power to receive bribes has decreased significantly in recent years," said the director of Administration and Public Function Services (SAFP), Leong Weng In, citing the Commissioner against Corruption (CCAC). The reduction of cases involving abuse of power and bribes is attributed to the harsh combat to the phenomenon, as well as the awareness actions carried out by CCAC to change mindsets in the civil service, is indicated in a response to the interpellation of Deputy Nick Law by the SAFP director. Leong Weng In cites CCAC in an analysis of the most frequent types of offenses these days. "Currently, cases related to public services workers are mainly related to the violation of the general duties to which they are subject, such as cases of falsification of attendance records and illegal accumulation of functions, which demonstrates that their work has achieved positive results," is indicated. Good behavior To keep up with the evolution of the type of infractions more frequently committed, CCAC has adjusted the content of awareness actions “depending on the trend”. “CCAC has continually drawing their attention also, in the context of training, to the importance of ethical conduct,” is indicated by Leong Weng In. The SAFP Director even points out that after infringements are detected, "many public services invite, by its initiative CCAC." The fight against corruption is a continuous and long -term process that has to be viewed with a pragmatic and realistic attitude so that it can be effective to respond to my trends of infringements, it is still mentioned.

item.title: Game | Seaport estimates 9% of revenues in the second half
item.description: According to the latest projection of Seaport Research Partners analysts, the Macao game industry can record a 9 percent annual increase in gross revenues during the second half of the year. It is recalled that, according to data from the Game Inspection and Coordination Directorate (DICJ), the territory casinos invoiced 113.03 billion patacas in brute revenues in the second half of last year. item.title: Sport | 26 million supports for athletes and associations
item.description:
Between April and June this year, the Sport Fund assigned support of 26.1 million patacas. The most supported entity was the Macao Football Association, receiving 3.18 million Patacas
The Sport Fund distributed 26.1 million patacas on support to athletes and associations in the second quarter of the year. The data were updated on the Portal of the Directorate of Supervision and Management of Public Assets (DSSGAP). The most supported entity in the second quarter was the Macao Football Association by receiving 3.18 million patacas, which represented 12.2 percent of the total distributed supports. The soccer association also received one of the largest unit support, in this case in the amount of almost 526,000 Patacas, for the organization of football championships 7 in the U14 and U-12 categories. The second most supported entity was the Macau-China General Association of Automobile by receiving a total of 2.77 million patacas, between six subsidies to support pilots or rent facilities. Only in facilities rental costs alone, the association received 1.4 million patacas, although about 514,000 patacas still respects a rental for December last year. Also in this case, when evaluated the proportion of the supports, AAMC received more than 10 percent of the supports distributed to 55 associations. In terms of unit subsidies, the largest amount delivered to the Macau-China General Automobile Association and reached 576,000 patacas. This amount was distributed in April and again in May and was justified with the support of the participation of six local riders in proofs abroad. Gold wushu However, the highest unit support reached the amount of 1.32 million patacas and was distributed to the General Association of Wushu de Macao, with the official explanation of the second installment of the “Financial Support Plan for the Training of Elite Athletes and Teams in Internship 2025 - subsidies for elite athletes and the Wushu Internship team”. Between April and June, the Wushu Association was one of the most supported by the Sport Fund, in second place, receiving about 2.67 million Patacas, among 12 different subsidies, which represented 10.2 percent of total financial support. The second largest unit support was 813,000 patacas and was recipient by the Macau-China Dragon Boat Association. The official justification indicates that the subsidy filed the second installment of the “Financial Support Plan for the Training of Elite Athletes and Teams in Internship 2025 - Dragon Boat Elite Athletes”. In total, the Dragon Boat Association received four different subsidies that totaled 975,000 patacas, with the remaining supports to fit the organization of local evidence or participation in events abroad. The data also show that the support of the sport fund grew 3.5 million patacas compared to the same period.

item.title: New Grand | Shun Tak gives “great importance” to fallen coating
item.description: Nova Grand Block 5 in the center of the mud was one of the buildings affected by the Tupão Wipha Sunday through Macao, with the fall of the outer lining of a high altitude building to the public road. item.title: Typhoon | AI warn you to close parks, rails and bicycle tracks
item.description:
The need to ensure the safety of bicycle parks, rails and clues after the Wipha Typhoon passed, led AI to temporarily end numerous spaces. The reopening of many of them started yesterday and should last for the next few days, when security is assured
Typhoon Wipha's passage led the Institute to Municipal Affairs (AMI) to declare the closure of all rails and tracks for bicycles and the “majority” of public parks. The announcement was made yesterday morning, but from the afternoon, more than 80 percent of the parks were reopened, although the date of reopening of several spaces is not yet known. "Due to the impact of Typhoon Wipha, green and recreational facilities, such as parks, walking tracks and cycling clues, suffered damage from different degrees throughout the territory of Macao," he was reported. "In order to protect public safety, all pedestrian rails and most parks have been temporarily closed and we hope that residents will understand and cooperate with us, refraining from entering places without authorization," he was added. Despite these closures, AMI ensures that “more than 90 percent of leisure zones” are open to the public, such as the eight public markets. The list of open spaces announced in the morning was made up of the São Francisco Garden, Triangular Jardim da Areia da Preta, atrium of the Institute building for municipal affairs, lake building platform, Hac Sá Park, Jardim da Vitória and Terrace Jardim of Seac Community Community Father Van. However, in the afternoon, the list was the reopening was updated. PARKS INFORMATION To inform that public facilities are actually closed, AMI ensures that in all entrances of parks and rails are notices for the population about the closing. “The Institute for Municipal Affairs has posted warnings at the entrances of parks, pedestrian tracks and bicycle tracks that are temporarily closed to the public, advising him to avoid entering the tree-lined areas and staying under the trees during the storm period or the following days to avoid accidents,” was communicated in Chinese. "The parks will be progressively opened upon completion of the necessary inspection and discharge work, and the opening list will be published on the IAM portal," he was explained. Typhoon Wipha has passed Macau in recent days, making five minor injuries, as well as 163 occurrences that led the authorities to intervene. Typhoon signal 8 was lifted at 4am on Sunday, and throughout the day the alert level was rising until signal number 10 at 12:30 pm was lifted. About 10 hours later, signal number three was lifted, and the end of the immediate prevention state was declared.

item.title: Social Support | Refused about 28% of requests
item.description: The Secretary General of the Macao Ho Kuok Meng Disabled Support Association, pointed out that among the 150 requests to assign special allowance under the Inclusion and Harmony Program in the community, 40 were refused. Speaking to Radio Macau's Chinese channel, Ho pointed out that most refusals were arrested that candidates have higher income to the maximum level allowed to receive support, difficulties in contacting candidates or a level of disability that is not covered by support. The numbers indicated point to a reality in which 72 percent of requests were approved, while 28 percent were refused. In turn, in response to TDM, the Institute of Social Action promised to “continue reviewing and improve the program”. In the Macao Forum Morning Program, a resident of a nickname Che, which criticized the conditions of access to the subsidy of the Inclusion and Harmony Program because they consider that they are disadvantaged from the local reality. The listener argued that the support must be planned for more illness situations, as her sister failed to walk, but this support was denied to her. The support was only approved when the sister was diagnosed with cancer. At the same time, the listener asked the application process to be simpler.

item.title: Japanese children join Portugal to protect the ocean
item.description: Dozens of Japanese children joined yesterday at Expo2025 in Osaka, an appeal to protect the seas, which the Lisbon Oceanarium wants to take the UN summit on climate change in November, Brazil. “Do you want to be ocean ambassadors here in Japan?” Asked at the Portugal Pavilion, Marine Biologist Natacha Moreira, from the Blue Ocean Foundation, to the students of two classes of an Osaka school. The positive response came in a unison chorus of 40 voices, the first Japanese young people to sign the mini 30x30, “a wave” launched by the blue ocean and the oceanarium, in support of the world's ocean -protecting 30 percent goal by 2030. The Oceanarian Director of Education, Diogo Geraldes, told Lusa that a first letter was delivered during the third UN conference, which Nice, France, in June. A new version of the document will be delivered to the United Nations Conference on Climate Change (COP30), which will take place in November in Belém, the state capital of Pará, northern Brazil. The appeal has already gathered the support of 9,500 young people from 27 countries, but in Asia still had contributions from Malaysian and Timor-Leste schools. The Oceanarium prepared materials on the Mini 30x30 in Japanese especially for Expo, which already existed in Portuguese, Spanish, French and English. Before they vote unanimously in favor of the appeal, the Japanese young people tested the interactive experiences of the Oceanarium in one of the two multi -arts of the Portugal Pavilion, whose theme is “Ocean: Blue Dialogue”. With history "The Lisbon Oceanarium is, in Portugal, the institution with more scrolls and experience in Blue Literacy. For over 25 years that has been teaching teachers and students to have a more sustainable relationship with the sea," Blue Ocean Executive Administrator Tiago Pitta and Cunha told Lusa. An experience that led the Oceanarium and the Blue Ocean, with the support of the Directorate-General for Education, to develop the Educar Program for a Blue Generation, which promotes ocean literacy among students from 6 to 10 years. Diogo Geraldes explained that they started in the first cycle because "it is easier to form teachers, who are often the same from the first to fourth year." For five years, the project has been training to 1,300 teachers in a pilot phase that took place in the municipalities of Albufeira, Cascais, Mafra, Moura, Nazaré, Peniche, Silves, Sintra and the Autonomous Region of the Azores. After the end of this phase, in May 2024, the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation decided to extend the program to all primary schools in the country and to include the ocean in the curriculum. Tiago Pitta and Cunha said the goal is to "educate the most conscious generation of the entire European Union regarding the connection of humans with the ocean." "We could, in the end, be a little, as the Nordicas went to the environment [terrestrial] from the 1970s, the Portuguese citizens would be for blue," explained the expert. Created in 2017 by the Francisco Manuel dos Santos Society, which includes in its heritage the Lisbon Oceanarium, the Blue Ocean is a non -profit entity, which aims to contribute to the conservation and sustainable use of the oceans.

item.title: MNE | China expresses the desire to reinforce partnership with EU before Cimeira
item.description: China yesterday expressed the intention of reinforcing the partnership with the European Union (EU), before the bilateral summit that takes place this week in Beijing, in a context marked by commercial tensions and geopolitical disputes. "The country hopes that the meeting with European leaders will send a positive signal to the international community that both parties are committed to strengthening their partnership and jointly defending multilateralism and open cooperation," said Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun. The diplomat indicated that relations between China and EU cross “a crucial moment”, with “new opportunities and challenges”, and that the summit will serve to “reinforce strategic communication” and “deepen dialogue and cooperation” at a time of growing global instability. According to Guo, the bilateral relationship has produced “fruit results” over the last 50 years, both in the economic plan and in the creation of international cooperation mechanisms. Summit China-EU is held on Thursday in Beijing to mark the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the two parts. The participation of Chinese President XI Jinping, the President of the European Commission, Ursula Von Der Leyen, and the President of the European Council, António Costa. The latter said on Monday that the relationship between China and the EU has a "crucial" role globally and expressed its intention to discuss with the Chinese authorities all points on the common agenda. Brussels has already indicated that it will address topics such as access to the Chinese market, war in Ukraine, climate change and the situation in the Middle East.

item.title: Food Security | Approved Standard for School Meals
item.description:
Lead food poisoning of 200 children in a day care center in Tianshui led authorities to apply new standards of demand to school menus
China approved the first national regulation for school meals, aiming to reinforce food safety after lead poisoning of more than 200 children in a core in the west of the country, authorities announced. The new regulation, issued by the state administration for the regulation of the market and which will enter into force on December 1, establishes requirements for companies responsible for the preparation and distribution of food in primary schools, secondary and kindergartens across the country, said state television CCTV. The rules provide for the designation of a main guardian for food security in each center, personal exclusively dedicated to the management and supervision of this area, and the creation of a dynamic risk control mechanism, which includes daily safety revisions, weekly danger identification and monthly analysis meetings. Regarding the acquisition of raw materials, the text determines that products such as rice, flour and cooking oil should be purchased centrally and at specific points. All main ingredients will also have to be submitted at least once a year to complete analyzes, including tests to the presence of pesticide waste. Food preparation should allow the monitoring, in real time, by schools, parents and students, the main steps of the process, through proper technology. Samples from each daily meal should be kept for a minimum of 48 hours. Improper for consumption The publication of the new standard occurs in a context of growing public concern with food in school establishments. Earlier this month, eight people were arrested as a result of leading lead poisoning that affected 233 children in a private day care in the city of Tianshui, western China. Those responsible for the establishment will have authorized the use of inappropriate substances for human consumption in the making of meals served to children. According to the authorities, the nursery kitchen used bought "online" dyes that contained lead and were labeled with warnings that they should not be ingested. Of the 251 children enrolled in the Center, 233 had abnormal levels of blood lead and 201 were hospitalized after symptoms such as nausea, diarrhea, leg pain or abdominal cramps, according to reports from parents cited by the local press. Food security has been a sensitive theme in China for decades, after several scandals that have shaken the population's confidence in quality control systems. One of the most serious cases occurred in 2008, with the contamination of milk with melamine, which caused the death of at least six babies and affected about 300,000 children.

item.title: Gaza | Pope asks for abbas help and protection of sacred places
item.description: The Pope asked yesterday "the proper entry of humanitarian aid" in Gaza "urgently", in a call with the president of the Palestinian authority in which he stressed "the obligation to protect the population and the sacred places." "Given the dramatic humanitarian situation, the urgency to assist those most exposed to the consequences of the conflict and allow the proper entry of humanitarian aid," said the Vatican, quoting Leo XIV. The Pontiff also renewed “its appeal to full respect for international humanitarian law” and emphasized “the obligation to protect civilians and sacred places”, as well as “the prohibition of indiscriminate use of force and forced population displacement”. In the telephone conversation, the two leaders discussed "the recent developments of the gaza range and violence in the West Bank." On Sunday, during the Angelus prayer, the Pope again manifested against violence in the Middle East after the Israeli attack last Thursday to the Parish of the Holy Family, the only Catholic Church in Gaza, which caused three dead and several wounded. The day after the attack, Leo XIV received a call from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, in which the Pope asked for a ceasefire and the end of the war in Gaza, as well as the protection of places of worship and the faithful. During his conversation with Abbas, the Pope also recalled the 10th anniversary of the comprehensive agreement between the Holy See and the State of Palestine, signed on June 26, 2015 and which came into force on January 2, 2016. The agreement, signed with the organization for the Liberation of Palestine (PLO), determines the formal recognition of the State of Palestine by the Holy See and, among other aspects, underlines the need for protection of holy Christian places in Palestine.

item.title: Jeju Air | Pilots shut down wrong engine, according to a report
item.description: Pilots of the Korean Jeju Air aircraft that had an accident in December last year will have been mistaken, the least damaged engine after the impact with a bird, yesterday indicated a source close to the investigation. According to the Korea Joongang Daily newspaper, the source said that the elements collected, including the voice recording of the cabin, computer data and a physical switch of the engine found between the wreckage, show that the riders turned off the left engine instead of the right to take emergency measurements after the impact with the bird, occurring moments before the expected landing. The investigation team, added the source, has “clear evidence” and will have reached a conclusion, even though the official report was not disclosed due to protests by relatives of the victims. The investigation to the accident in Muan (southwest of South Korea) has already revealed that Jeju Air, as part of its efforts to maximize the operational profitability of its aircraft, reduces the duration of maintenance reviews to each flight to the legal minimum. The rugged plane, a Boeing 737-800, was hit by a bird and eventually landed without acting the landmark or other braking systems, leaving the track and colliding with a wall at Muan airport. In the accident of December 29, 2024 179 passengers and members of the crew died, and there were two survivors. The accident was the most serious civil aviation disaster that occurred on South Korean soil and the worst of the year worldwide.

item.title: Japan | PM remains in office despite an electoral “hard blow”
item.description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said yesterday that he will remain in power after the party that presides over losing the majority in the upper House of Parliament in Sunday elections in a new political setback. "We continue to be the party with the greatest representation. Despite the hard blow and the many difficulties, many people supported us strongly," Ishiba said at a press conference, stating that the decision to remain in office is due to the global political situation and the "difficult conditions" that the country is going through. In this sense, the leader highlighted the imposition of customs tariffs on the United States, inflation and fear that a strong earthquake or a natural catastrophe can reach the country at some point. The Democratic Liberal Party (PLD) of Ishiba and coalition partner, Komeito, who needed to win 50 seats, in addition to the 75 they already have to maintain the majority, got 47. There were three places left for most and there was a 19 -seat retreat from what they had before the elections. The defeat is another blow to the Ishiba coalition, making it a minority in both cameras after the defeat in October in the Baixa Chamber elections, and aggravating Japan's political instability. It was the first time the PLD-led coalition has lost the majority in both parliament chambers since party formation in 1955. Up and down Asked about the possibility of widening the coalition to other opposition parties, Ishiba said it had no intention of doing so at this time and stated that the PLD "must be responsible and develop policies." The official also excluded the possibility of government remodeling. "We will seriously consult the other parties and talk about responsibility and continue with the policies in terms of tariffs and catastrophes," he added. Among the opposition parties, the Left Liberal Constitutional Democratic Party (CDP) was in second place with 22 places, while the Popular Democratic Party (PDP) reformist was third with 17. The surprise was the Japanese nationalist party of far right Sanseito, who, under the motto "Japan first", emerged as one of the great winners of Sunday's elections, winning 14 seats and becoming the third largest opposition party.

item.title: Security | Beijing defends respect for law after prohibition of departure to US citizen
item.description: China has defended yesterday that everyone should respect their laws after news that a US government official has been prevented from leaving the country since April for alleged national security reasons. "Regardless of whether it is a Chinese or foreign citizen, everyone should respect Chinese laws while in China," Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun said at a press conference. Guo stressed that China is a rule of law and that manages the issues of entry and exit of the territory “according to the law”, however, refusing to provide specific details about the case. According to the Hong Kong South China Morning Post newspaper, the citizen in question is an employee of the US Department of Commerce, of Chinese and former Military origin, who traveled in April to the city of Chengdu for personal reasons. Upon arrival, he was informed that he could not leave the country. Sources cited by the same newspaper indicate that the case may be related to an alleged omission in the statement of their status as a civil servant during the visa request. Although not formally accused, the citizen was later transferred to Beijing, accompanied by a consular US representative. Its current whereabouts has not been confirmed. According to South China Morning Post, the so -called “output prohibitions” are applied in China to local or foreign citizens involved in civil litigation, criminal investigations or considered a threat to national security.

item.title: China | Actions go up after Price War Promises
item.description: Chinese financial squares have reacted high in recent sessions, after Beijing promises to lock the price wars that have penalized companies' profits and aggravated commercial tensions with partners such as the United States and the European Union. The dominant expression between authorities and analysts is “involution” - a reference to the effort to contain excessive competition and the overcapacity of production in sectors such as solar panels, steel and electric vehicles. With still weak demand and increased external trade barriers - including higher US tariffs under the presidency of Donald Trump - many Chinese manufacturers have chosen to cut prices, reducing profit margins and leading several companies to bankruptcy. The price index in the producer, which measures the prices of departure from factories, has been falling for almost three years in China in a prolonged deflation cycle. The trend has already been reflected in global markets, with low exports at low prices generating commercial friction with partners such as Washington, Brussels, but also several developing countries. Faced with pressure, the Chinese government and various industrial associations have recently signaled a change of course. On June 30, the 10 largest glass manufacturers for solar panels agreed to reduce production by 30 percent. Authorities also launched a car safety inspection campaign to lock cost cutting practices that compromise quality. The measures boosted the actions in pressured sectors. Although foreign investors cannot directly buy Chinese actions, they have access to about 2,700 titles and 250 funds through the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. Superior condemnation The measures follow high-level statements against the so-called “disordered competition”. On June 29, the People's Diary, the Chinese Communist Party's official newspaper, published an extensive first page editorial condemning the “Involution” phenomenon as opposed to the “high quality” economic development objectives in the country. Chinese President Xi Jinping defended a greater regulation on local incentives for the installation of factories, considered cause of overcapacity in strategic sectors. Economists argue that it will be necessary to consolidate sectors through mergers and bankruptcy, but recognize that the process will be slow, especially due to the resistance of local governments, committed to protecting companies and regional jobs.

item.title: European Union | China appeals to cooperation despite divergences
item.description:
António Costa and Ursula von der Leyen arrive at Beijing Thursday for meetings with Xi Jinping and Li Qiang with a view to establishing a closer approximation between the two parts compared to global instability
China yesterday appealed to cooperation with the European Union, despite the differences, and criticized what it has classified as exaggerations about commercial disputes and unfounded accusations of its position in the face of the war in Ukraine. "The Chinese government expects the EU to advance the same direction, to exceed the differences and jointly plan cooperation for the next 50 years," Foreign Ministry spokesman Guo Jiakun said at a press conference. Guo criticized what he described as an insistence on the part of “some people in Europe” in the so-called “triple characterization” of China-as a partner, competitor and systemic rival-and accused them of “unilaterally exaggerating economic and commercial issues” and launching “unfounded accusations” about Ukraine, which, according to Beijing, has generated “unnecessary disturbances” in the bilateral relationship. The spokesman pointed out that after half a century of diplomatic relations, the connection between China and the EU "accumulated sufficient experience and positive energy to resist change and overcome challenges." "The realization of the China - EU summit has great meaning and has caught the broad attention of the international community," he said, stressing that both parties are "great forces that drive multilateralism, large markets that support globalization and great civilizations that promote diversity." Constructive conversations The summit between China and the EU is held this Thursday, July 24, in Beijing, to mark the 50th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations. item.title: Anabela Santiago, Academic: “China is a reformist and moderate”
item.description:
Anabela Santiago has just defended at the University of Aveiro the doctoral thesis that analyzes how China has been positioned in recent decades as an important actor in the “global health governance”. Today, Beijing seeks “alternative mechanisms” of cooperation in the “global south” and tries to build an alternative model to the World Health Organization
Let's start with the concept of Global Health Governance (GGS). Is this a more contemporary concept or relating to the post-war period and the Foundation of the World Health Organization (WHO)? What have been the main actors of this governance until China's growth? GGS is a concept whose prominence and relevance have grown significantly in the 21st century, largely driven by economic globalization and worldwide interconnection. Although global health has always transcended national borders, demanding multidisciplinary approaches and international cooperation, only from the 1990s it was made greater awareness of it. Historically, GGS has been predominantly influenced by western powers and neoliberal values. The main actors of this governance, until China's growth, were historically marked by interventions of entities such as WHO and non-governmental, predominantly American and European organizations. One of the findings of its doctoral thesis is that China has been progressively positioning itself in this leadership. This position started specifically when and why? Yes, China has been progressively positioned as a relief actor in the evolution of the GG system. Although it is not possible to point out an exact date of start, China has evolved from a relatively isolated country to a main actor in global political, economic and technological arenas. Its growing economic and political influence also represents a change in GGS's historical dynamics, and in the 1960s China tried to play a humanitarian health care role in neighboring countries and Africa. The thesis points out that China's experience can be seen as an example of what is achievable when a state chooses its own way rather than a pre-established model, aligning itself with the 21st century prediction as the "century of Asia." Did the pandemic years influence this position? How? Covid-19 pandemic highlighted the need for global health cooperation, as well as the potential consequences of the failure to prioritize global health. The thesis explores the evolution of the Health Silk Route before and after the pandemic, indicating that the pandemic years allowed greater awareness of the need for instruments such as the Health Silk Route as the most effective cooperation platforms among nations. Although not detailed in this specific section, it is implicit that the pandemic intensified China's performance in health diplomacy and health development assistance. Looking at the internal reforms that China has carried out in the health area, which highlights as the most important? I approach, in the thesis, the reforms of the China Health System and I point out that the Chinese governance model is a unique combination of state -oriented economic reforms and development by the state, incorporating elements of neoliberalism and authoritarianism into political issues in general, and the health sector is nothing different from the rest. One of China's mentioned contributions, recognized by WHO, is its primary health care model based on the recognized good practice of “barefoot doctors” (barefoot doctors). In addition, the thesis analyzes the main reform policies and their progress and challenges in the period 2009-2018, which comprise the reforms of primary health care, hospital and pharmaceutical reform. The “Healthy China 2030” program is also an important and ambitious reference of China's domestic reforms in health, also encompassing social determinants. Is Beijing's intention to create an alternative entity to WHO, or simply create an alternative movement that can coexist with WHO, in the context of the relationship with the global south? How could this work? The thesis suggests that China adopts a "dual approach": while integrating in existing global structures, forging simultaneously alternative paths, particularly through regional alliances such as BRICS and partnerships with Global South. This indicates an intention to create an alternative movement that can coexist and complement the role of WHO, rather than a direct alternative entity. China demonstrates a clear commitment to align the objectives of the “Belt and Road” initiative with the united nations sustainable development objectives, showing their willingness to present these initiatives as complements to the existing cooperation mechanisms in the international liberal order. President Xi Jinping's view of a “future community shared for humanity”, which includes the notion of a “global health community for all”, also points to a new perspective in international cooperation. Traditional Chinese Masks, Vaccines and Medicine (MTC): What are China's products or instruments to position itself as an increasingly global actor in GGS? The thesis points out that China is an indispensable provider of global public health, essential for the product supply chain, such as masks and vaccines. The MTC is also mentioned as one of China's great contributions to global health governance, with its chinese herbal treatments, some of which already recognized by WHO in 2017. In addition, Chinese medical assistance and medical teams sent to other regions of the globe are important instruments of Chinese health diplomacy. In creating an alternative movement or reality to WHO, China may be taking advantage of the lack of full representativeness in the same WHO, or gaps in its operation? The thesis does not address directly whether China is taking advantage of a lack of full representativeness in WHO or gaps in its operation. However, it emphasizes that the work aims to fill a gap in scientific knowledge in relation to the paradigm of health governance from a non-western and liberal perspective, emphasizing China as an actor of the global south. This suggests that China seeks to strengthen alternative models that can offer more personalized health challenges, different from those defended by Western countries, positioning itself as a moderate reformist actor. How has the European Union (EU) foreign policy in relation to China affecting or influenced this position of the country in global health governance? In the thesis, the fourth publication, entitled "Challenges on the European Union-China Cooperation in Higher Education from" People-To-People Dialogue ’Perspective: The Case of Health-Related Joint Projects," explores cooperation in higher education, in particular that includes health-related projects. Therefore, despite the strategic and economic dialogue, the deterioration of UE-china bilateral relations intensified, with the commission to assume a decline of enthusiasm due to “China's countermeasures to EU human rights sanctions, economic coercion and commercial measures against the single market, and the positioning of China in the war in Ukraine”. Although challenges and tensions are recognized, cooperation in higher education, including health projects, is seen as part of a broader picture of strategic partnership between EU and China. However, it is evident that there is no long tradition of health cooperation between EU and China in higher education, and that there are few joint projects compared to the general panorama. It is suggested that both EU and China should make more efforts to align medical study curricula and promote more joint research in areas related to health, infectious diseases, among others. In the Trump 2.0 era, and without pandemic, what could be China's role in global health governance? Although the thesis is published this year, it focuses on the preceding period and includes the pandemic, where it does not speculate directly on a future scenario of “Trump 2.0” without pandemic. However, the thesis argues that China is not just a participant, but a moderate reformist force in the formation of global health standards. Regardless of future political scenarios, their growing economic and political influence, strategic health diplomacy, internal reforms and initiatives such as the Health Silk Route will continue to shape their role in global health governance. The view of a “global health community for all” also remains a guiding principle for China's efforts. Does this power of China in GGS verify more with bilateral or multilateral agreements? The thesis suggests that China's power in global health governance manifests itself through both bilateral and multilateral agreements, but with a growing emphasis on certain forms of cooperation that strengthen their role in the global south and through alternative mechanisms. Although the thesis does not explicitly quantify the predominance between bilateral and multilateral, the focus on regional alliances (BRICS) and partnerships with the Global South (which often involve bilateral agreements and group cooperation initiatives) and the Health Silk Route indicate a hybrid approach.

Professor at the University of Science and Technology of Macao and a scholar of the presence of Camões in Asia, Philip de Saavedra understands that Macau is missing an interpretative center about the poet's life and work. The academic spoke yesterday at the National Library in Lisbon, about the correspondence written by Luís de Camões in Asia
He participated yesterday at the “from Lisbon to Goa: What the Letters of Camões” participated. What path does the East arise portrayed in these letters, and who were directed? The letters Camões wrote from Asia are in the order of the dozens. There is in them scholarship, philosophy, and also a lot of humor, sarcasm, and satire of humanist nature. Some were written from Ternate, others from Malaca, Macau, probably others from Cambodia, to recipients in India and Portugal. With the exception of the letters of Goa, where the identification of the writing site is generally present, maping those that were written during the rest of it would be a complex task. They are only given as written in Asia. Can you give examples of written letters in this context? I mention here two of the first he sent to the kingdom. The epistle whose first line is “The Poet Simony speaking” was written in January 1554, when Camões has just arrived in Goa, destined for his pupil, D. António de Noronha. It is a very emotional letter, giving it the storm that had plagued the Armada in the Cape of Good Hope, "seeing the death of the before me." Camões survived this limit experience aboard the São Bento ship, the only one to arrive that year to Goa, and which was lost in the turn of the Christmas lands, dying in this second bid the Captain Fernão de Álvares Cabral, and many of those who traveled with him. In addition to the news of his salvation, the poet was equally eager to tell his friend the expedition of D. Afonso de Noronha to Malabar, in which he had taken part in the previous month.
